definition: The marine cold-water sphere describes a water mass extending from the polar seas and across low latitudes at depths of ca. 800 to 1000 m, which is separated from the marine warm-water sphere by the permanent marine thermocline

label: marine warm-water sphere
definition: The marine warm-water sphere describes a water mass extending to depths of ca. 800 to 1000 m in low and middle latitudes. It is separated from the marine cold-water sphere by the permanent marine thermocline

label: hydrogenous sediment
definition: Hydrogenous sediment is derived from solutes that precipitate out of sea water by a variety of chemical reactions. These are typically less abundant than other sediment types.

label: cosmogenous sediment
definition: Cosmogenous sediment is derived from extraterrestrial dust and debris in the form of meteorites and similar entities.

label: polymetallic nodule
definition: Polymetallic nodules, also called manganese nodules, are rock concretions on the sea bottom formed of concentric layers of iron and manganese hydroxides around a core. Nodules vary in size from tiny particles visible only under a microscope to large pellets more than 20 centimetres (8 in) across. However, most nodules are between 5 and 10 cm in diameter.

label: suspended sediment
definition: Suspended sediment, or suspended load, is the term for the particles settle  slowly enough to be carried in flowing water (such as a stream or coastal area) either without touching the bed or while only intermittently touching it. These particles are generally of the fine sand, silt and clay size, although larger particles may be carried as well depending on the intensity of the flow.

label: boulder sediment
definition: Sediment characterised by an average particle diameter greater than 256 mm.

label: cobble sediment
definition: Sediment characterised by an average particle diameter between 64 and 256 mm.

label: pebble sediment
definition: Sediment characterised by an average particle diameter between 4 and 32 mm.

label: granular sediment
definition: Sediment characterised by an average particle diameter between 2 and 4 mm.

label: sandy sediment
definition: Sediment characterised by an average particle diameter between 62.5 micrometers and 2 mm.

label: silty sediment
definition: Sediment characterised by an average particle diameter between 3.9 and 62.5 micrometers.

label: clay sediment
definition: Sediment characterised by an average particle diameter between 1 and 3.9 micrometers.

label: colloidal sediment
definition: Sediment characterised by an average particle diameter below 1 micrometer.

label: marine hydrothermal vent
definition: A marine hydrothermal vent is a marine benthic feature where heat generated due to tectonic activity, either at divergent plate boundaries or convergent ocean plates where back-arc spreading occurs, is released or 'vented' to the surface. The resultant high temperature water jets are laden with dissolved metals and minerals.

label: marine sponge reef biome
definition: The marine sponge reef biome comprises marine reefs primarily built by marine sponges. The primary frame-building sponges are all members of the order Hexactinosa. They are found only in glacier-scoured troughs of low-angle continental shelf. The seafloor is stable and consists of rock, coarse gravel, and large boulders.

label: marine supra-littoral zone
definition: The supralittoral zone is the area above the spring high tide line that is regularly splashed, but not submerged by ocean water. Seawater penetrates these elevated areas only during storms with high tides.

label: marine littoral zone
definition: The marine littoral zone is a littoral zone which extends, approximately, from the spray region above the high tide mark to the edge of the coninental shelf.

label: marine sub-littoral zone
definition: The marine sublittoral zone is part of the marine littoral zone which is permanently covered by seawater. In physical oceanography, the sublittoral zone refers to coastal regions with significant tidal flows and energy dissipation, including non-linear flows, internal waves, river outflows and oceanic fronts. In practice, this typically extends to the edge of the continental shelf, with depths around 200 meters. In marine biology, the sublittoral refers to the areas where sunlight reaches the ocean floor, that is, where the water is never so deep as to take it out of the photic zone.

label: marine cold seep biome
definition: A marine benthic biome which is determined by a cold seep.

label: dilution basin mediterranean sea biome
definition: The dilution basin mediterranean sea biome comprises expressions of the mediterranean sea biome with lower salinity than the surrounding ocean due to freshwater gains such as rainfall and rivers. Water exchange consists of outflow of the fresher mediterranean water in the upper layer and inflow of the saltier oceanic water in the lower layer of the channel. Renewal of deep water may not be sufficient to supply oxygen to the bottom.

label: marine hydrothermal vent chimney
definition: A column of solid material which has been progressively deposited around a hydrothermal vent.

label: marine hydrothermal plume
definition: A marine hydrothermal vent plume, part of a marine hydrothermal vent, is a high temperature water jet laden with dissolved metals and minerals that is driven by heat generated due to tectonic activity below the vent.

label: mesophilic sediment
definition: Sediment characterised by a temperature of 15-45 degrees Celsius and high-to-low oxygenation. Often impacted by hydrothermal fluid flows.

label: thermophilic sediment
definition: Sediment characterised by a temperature of 45-75 degrees Celsius and low to no oxygen content. Often impacted by hydrothermal fluid flows.

label: hyperthermophilic sediment
definition: Sediment characterised by a temperature of 80-125 degrees Celsius and no oxygen content. Often impacted by hydrothermal fluid flows.

label: hydrothermal fluid
definition: High temperature water ejected from hydrothermal vents and laden with dissolved metals and minerals as a result of percolation through crustal rocks.

label: nitrate-reducing sediment
definition: Sediment hosting and characterised by active nitrate reducing microbial communities.

label: drop stone
definition: An isolated fragment of rock, which fell vertically through the water column into  finer-grained water-deposited sedimentary rocks. Drop stones range in size from small pebbles to boulders.

label: organic matter fall
definition: An accumulation of organic matter that has fallen to the bottom of a body of water.

label: plant matter fall
definition: A accumulation of plant matter that has fallen to the bottom of a body of water.

label: animal carcass fall
definition: The carcass of an animal that has fallen to the bottom of a body of water.

label: whale fall
definition: Whale fall is the term used for a whale carcass that has fallen to the ocean floor. When a whale dies in shallow water, its carcass is typically devoured by scavengers over a relatively short period of time: within several months. However, in deeper water (depths of 2,000 m/6,600 ft or greater), fewer scavenger species exist, and the carcass can provide sustenance for a complex localized ecosystem over periods of decades.

label: seal fall
definition: Seal fall is the term used for a seal carcass that has fallen to the ocean floor.

label: wood fall
definition: A wood fall describes an accumulation of woody plant material that has fallen to the ocean floor.

label: marine coral reef deep fore reef
manganese-reducing sediment
definition: Sediment hosting and characterised by active manganese reducing microbial communities.

label: iron-reducing sediment
definition: Sediment hosting and characterised by active iron reducing microbial communities.

label: sulphate-reducing sediment
definition: Sediment hosting and characterised by active sulphate reducing microbial communities.

label: carbon dioxide-reducing sediment
definition: Sediment hosting and characterised by active carbon dioxide reducing microbial communities.

label: organic material
definition: Environmental material derived from living organisms and composed primarily of one or more biomacromolecules.

label: biofilm material
definition: Material derived from a biofilm, an aggregate of microorganisms in which cells adhere to each other and/or to a surface. These adherent cells are frequently embedded within a self-produced matrix of extracellular polymeric substance (EPS). Biofilm EPS, which is also referred to as slime, is a polymeric conglomeration generally composed of extracellular DNA, proteins, and polysaccharides in various configurations.

label: microbial mat material
definition: Material derived from a microbial mat, a multi-layered sheet of micro-organisms, mainly bacteria and archaea. Microbial mats create a wide range of internal chemical environments.

label: marine snow
definition: Marine snow is a continuous shower of mostly organic detritus falling from the upper layers of the water column. Its origin lies in activities within the productive photic zone.

label: obsolete organic feature
definition: A prominent or distinctive aspect, quality, or characteristic pertaining to or derived from living organisms.

label: marine pockmark
definition: Pockmarks are craters in the seabed resulting from the release of gas or liquid. Generally, they are formed in soft, fine-grained seabed sediments by the escape of fluids (gas or water, but mainly methane) into the water column.

label: marine sponge reef
definition: A marine sponge reef is marine reefs primarily built by marine sponges. The primary frame-building sponges are all members of the order Hexactinosa. They are found only in glacier-scoured troughs of low-angle continental shelf. The seafloor is stable and consists of rock, coarse gravel, and large boulders.

label: organ
definition: A collection of tissues joined in structural unit to serve a common function.

label: photophore
definition: A photophore is a light-emitting organ which appears as luminous spots on various marine animals, including fish and cephalopods. The organ can be simple, or as complex as the human eye; equipped with lenses, shutters, color filters and reflectors. The light can be produced from compounds during the digestion of prey, from specialized mitochondrial cells in the organism, called photocytes ("light producing" cells) , or, similarly, associated with symbiotic  bacteria in the organism.

label: root nodule
definition: Root nodules occur on the roots of plants that associate with symbiotic nitrogen-fixing bacteria.

label: trophosome
definition: A specialised organ found in deep-sea tube worms populating hydrothermal vent environments that is colonised by chemosynthetic bacteria which supply the host worm with organic compounds. The term may be applied to similar organs in other worms.

label: mycetome
definition: A specialized organ that is linked to the gut in beetles and host to a symbiotic yeast. The yeast cells assist in the digestion of less nutritious foods, supply needed B-vitamins and sterols, and provide resistance to certain toxins.

label: determinate root nodule
definition: Determinate nodules are root nodules found on tropical (sub)legumes, such as those of the genera Glycine (soybean), Phaseolus  (common bean), Lotus, and Vigna. Determinate nodules lose meristematic activity shortly after initiation, thus growth is due to cell expansion resulting in mature nodules which are spherical in shape.

label: indeterminate root nodule
definition: Indeterminate nodules are found on temperate legumes like Pisum  (pea), Medicago (alfalfa), Trifolium (clover), and Vicia (vetch). They earned the moniker "indeterminate" because they maintain an active apical meristem that produces new cells for growth over the life of the nodule. Because they are actively growing, indeterminate nodules manifest zones which demarcate different stages of development/symbiosis.

label: indeterminate root nodule active meristem
definition: A part of an indeterminate root nodule where new nodule tissue is formed which will later differentiate into the other zones of the nodule.

label: indeterminate root nodule infection zone
definition: A part of an indeterminate root nodule permeated with infection threads full of bacteria. The plant cells are larger than in the previous zone and cell division is halted.

label: indeterminate root nodule nitrogen fixation zone
definition: A part of an indeterminate root nodule where each cell contains a large, central vacuole and the cytoplasm is filled with fully differentiated bacteroids which are actively fixing nitrogen. Typically, the plant provides these cells with leghemoglobin, resulting in a distinct pink color.

label: indeterminate root nodule senescent zone
definition: A part of an indeterminate root nodule where plant cells and their bacteroid contents are being degraded. The breakdown of the heme component of leghemoglobin results in a visible greening at the base of the nodule.

label: anoxic water
definition: Water which lacks dissolved oxygen.

label: forest biome
definition: A forest ecosystem in which dominant ecological communities have reached their climax successional state.

label: woodland biome
definition: A woodland biome is a terrestrial biome which includes, across its entire spatial extent, woody plants spaced sufficiently far apart to allow light penetration to support communities of herbaceous plants or shrubs living closer to the woodland floor.

label: shrubland biome
definition: A shrubland biome is a terrestrial biome which includes, across its entire spatial extent, dense groups of shrubs.

label: grassland biome
definition: A grassland ecosystem in which dominant ecological communities have reached their climax successional state.

label: savanna biome
definition: A savanna biome is a woodland biome which has seasonal water availability and includes, across its entire spatial extent, trees spaced sufficiently far apart to allow an unbroken layer of grass, sedge (Cyperaceae) or  rush (Juncaceae) communities to live.

label: desert biome
definition: A desert biome is a terrestrial biome which loses more liquid water by evapotranspiration than is supplied by precipitation and includes communities adapted to these conditions.

label: tundra biome
definition: A terrestrial biome which comprises a tundra ecosystem that has reached its climax community.

label: mangrove biome
definition: A mangrove biome is a terrestrial biome which includes, across its spatial extent, mangrove plants (Rhizophoraceae). Mangrove plants are able to withstand high levels of salinity as well as regions of anoxia and frequent tidal inundation. Mangrove biomes often occur near tropical and sub-tropical estuaries and depositional marine coastal environments where fine sediments (often with high organic content) collect in areas protected from high energy wave action.

label: temperate desert biome
definition: A temperate desert biome is a desert biome which has communities adapted to intermediate insolation, low rainfall, and large temperature variations between winter and summer. Winter temperatures may fall below 0 degrees Celsius. Some precipitation in this biome may fall as snow.

label: tropical desert biome
definition: A tropical desert biome is a desert biome which has communities adapted to temperatures above a monthly average of 18 degrees Celsius, high daily temperature ranges of approximately 20 degrees Celsius, very high insolation due to inhibited cloud formation, and very low precipitation. Tropical desert biomes located near coasts with cold upwellings may have cooler temperatures and reduced insolution due to fog.

label: subtropical desert biome
definition: A subtropical desert biome is a desert biome which has communities adapted to temperatures above a monthly average of 18 degrees Celsius, high daily temperature ranges of approximately 20 degrees Celsius, high insolation (but lower than that of a tropical desert biome), inhibited cloud formation, and very low precipitation. Subtropical desert biomes located near coasts with cold upwellings may have cooler temperatures and reduced insolution due to fog.

label: montane desert biome
definition: A montane desert biome is a desert biome which occurs in regions elevated above sea level and which has community structure determined by elevation-dependent environmental conditions.

label: polar desert biome
definition: A polar desert biome is a desert biome which is subject to low levels of insolation, annual precipitation less than 250 millimeters, and a mean temperature less than 10 degrees Celsius during its warmest month. Temperature changes in polar deserts frequently cross the freezing point of water.

label: flooded savanna biome
definition: A flooded savanna biome is a savanna biome which has very wet to saturated soil moisture content.

label: subtropical grassland biome
definition: A subtropical grassland in which dominant ecological communities have reached their climax successional state.

label: montane grassland biome
definition: A montane grassland biome is a grassland biome which occurs in regions elevated above sea level and which has community structure determined by elevation-dependent environmental conditions.

label: coniferous forest biome
definition: A coniferous forest biome is a forest biome which contains densely packed populations or communities of coniferous trees, strongly limiting light penetration to the forest floor.

label: broadleaf forest biome
definition: A broadleaf forest in which dominant ecological communities have reached their climax successional state.

label: mixed forest biome
definition: A mixed forest in which dominant ecological communities have reached their climax successional state.

label: mediterranean forest biome
definition: A mediterranean forest in which dominant ecological communities have reached their climax successional state.

label: tropical broadleaf forest biome
definition: A tropical broadleaf forest in which dominant ecological communities have reached their climax successional state.

label: subtropical broadleaf forest biome
definition: A subtropical broadleaf forest in which dominant ecological communities have reached their climax successional state.

label: temperate broadleaf forest biome
definition: A broadleaf forest which is subject to temperate climate patterns.

label: environmental condition
definition: An environmental condition is a range of a determinate quality or combination of qualities that are present in an environmental system.

label: tropical
definition: A tropical condition is an environmental condition in which an environmental system receives high yearly solar irradiance per unit area and, on Earth, the Sun reaches a subsolar point at least once during the solar year. This results in a hot and moist year-round climate at low elevations, which have a monthly average temperature above 18 degrees Celsius.

label: subtropical
definition: A subtropical condition is an environmental condition in which an envrionmental system receives more solar irradiance than those with temperate conditions, but less than those with tropical conditions. At low elevations, this typically results in eight months of the year having average temperatures greater than or equal to 10 degrees Celsius with the coldest monthly temperature averaging between 2 and 13 degrees Celsius.

label: temperate
definition: A temperate condition is an environmental condition in which an environmental system receives less solar irradiance than those with subpolar conditions, but greater than those with subtropical conditions.

label: mediterranean
definition: A mediterranean condition is a subtropical condition in which hot dry summers and winters with moderate to high rainfall.

label: mediterranean woodland biome
definition: A subtropical woodland biome which includes communities adapted to hot to warm, dry summers, mild to cold, rainy winters, and the influence of large, usually marine, bodies of water.

label: subtropical coniferous forest biome
definition: A coniferous forest biome which is subject to subtropical climate patterns.

label: tropical coniferous forest biome
definition: A coniferous forest biome which is subject to tropical climate patterns.

label: temperate coniferous forest biome
definition: A coniferous forest biome which is subject to temperate climate patterns.

label: temperate mixed forest biome
definition: A temperate mixed forest in which dominant ecological communities have reached their climax successional state.

label: subtropical shrubland biome
definition: A shrubland biome which is subject to subtropical climate patterns.

label: montane shrubland biome
definition: A montane shrubland biome is a shrubland biome which occurs in regions elevated above sea level and which has community structure determined by elevation-dependent environmental conditions.

label: mediterranean shrubland biome
definition: A mediterranean shrubland biome is a subtropical shrubland biome which includes communities adapted to hot to warm, dry summers, mild to cold, rainy winters, and the influence of large, usually marine, bodies of water.

label: anthropogenic terrestrial biome
definition: An anthropogenic terrestrial biome is a terrestrial biome which has community structures determined by human activity.

label: subtropical woodland biome
definition: A woodland biome which is subject to subtropical climate patterns.

label: montane savanna biome
definition: A montane savanna biome is a savanna biome which occurs in regions elevated above sea level and which has community structure determined by elevation-dependent environmental conditions.

label: mediterranean grassland biome
definition: A subtropical grassland biome which includes communities adapted to hot to warm, dry summers, mild to cold, rainy winters, and the influence of large, usually marine, bodies of water.

label: subtropical dry broadleaf forest biome
definition: A subtropical dry broadleaf forest in which dominant ecological communities have reached their climax successional state.

label: subtropical moist broadleaf forest biome
definition: A subtropical moist broadleaf forest in which dominant ecological communities have reached their climax successional state.

label: tropical dry broadleaf forest biome
definition: A tropical dry broadleaf forest in which dominant ecological communities have reached their climax successional state.

label: tropical moist broadleaf forest biome
definition: A tropical moist broadleaf forest in which dominant ecological communities have reached their climax successional state.

label: mediterranean savanna biome
definition: A savanna biome which is subject to mediterranean climate patterns.

label: arid
definition: An environmental condition in which annual precipitation is less than half of annual potential evapotranspiration.

label: lava
definition: Lava is a mixture of molten or semi-molten rock, volatiles, and solids which has extruded beyond a planetary crust.

label: felsic lava
definition: Felsic lava is lava which is high in silica (> 69 percent by weight), aluminium, potassium, sodium, and calcium, forming a polymerized liquid rich in feldspar and quartz. Felsic lava has a  higher viscosity than other magma types. Felsic magmas can erupt at temperatures as low as 650 to 750 C. Unusually hot (>950 C) rhyolite lavas, however, may flow for distances of many tens of kilometres

label: intermediate lava
definition: Intermediate lava is lava which, relative to felsic lava, is lower in aluminium and silica (between 52 and 63 percent by weight), and usually somewhat richer in magnesium and iron. The temperature of intermediate lava ranges from 750 to 950 degrees Celsius, destroying polymerized bonds and promoting more fluid behaviour relative to felsic lavas and also a greater tendency to form phenocrysts. Higher iron and magnesium tends to manifest as a darker groundmass, and also occasionally amphibole or pyroxene phenocrysts.

label: mafic lava
definition: Mafic lava is lava which, relative to other lava types other than ultramafic lava, has a  high ferromagnesian content and low aluminium and silica content, with silca making up between 45 and 52 percent of its weight. Mafic lava generally erupts at temperatures in excess of 950 degrees Celsius. The high temperature and low polymerisation in mafic lava favors low viscosity and chemical diffusion, promoting the formation of large, well-formed phenocrysts.

label: ultramafic lava
definition: Ultramafic lava is lava which, relative to other lava types, has very high magnesium oxide content and less than 45 percent silica by weight is thought to have erupted at temperatures of 1600 degrees Celsius. Due to its high temperature and composition, the viscosity of ultramafic lava is very low.

label: basalt
definition: Basalt is a volcanic rock which is formed by the rapid cooling of basaltic lava.

label: coastal scrubland
definition: A coastal scrubland is a scrubland which is part of a coast.

label: polar
definition: A polar condition is an environmental condition in which an environmental system receives low, yearly solar irradiance per unit area, resulting in colder climatic conditions.

label: oak woodland
definition: An oak woodland is a woodland which has a tree community primarily composed of oak trees.

label: conifer woodland
definition: A conifer woodland is a woodland which has a tree community primarily composed of coniferous trees, from the Division Pinophyta, also known as Coniferophyta or Coniferae.

label: juniper woodland
definition: A juniper woodland is a woodland which has a tree community primarily composed of trees of the genus Juniperus.

label: desert scrubland
definition: A scrubland which is located in a desert.

label: boulder
definition: A piece of rock with a grain size above 300 millimetres in diameter. Smaller boulders are, at times, referred to as rocks or stones.

label: pinyon juniper woodland
definition: A pinyon juniper woodland is a conifer woodland which has a tree community primarily composed of trees of the subsection Cembroides of the genus Pinus and the genus Juniperus.

label: cropland biome
definition: A cropland ecosystem in which dominant ecological communities are maintained in a stable state - mimicking a climax community - by human intervention.

label: village biome
definition: A village biome is an anthropogenic terrestrial biome which contains settlements such as villages, towns, and/or small cities and which is primarily used for agricultural activity.

label: rangeland biome
definition: A rangeland biome is an anthropogenic terrestrial biome which is primarily used for the rearing and grazing of livestock.

label: dense settlement biome
definition: A dense settlement biome is an anthropogenic terrestrial biome which is primarily used for human habitation, recreation, and industry within built structures with little other land use.

label: urban biome
definition: An urban biome is a dense settlement biome which has been urbanised.

label: subpolar coniferous forest biome
definition: A  coniferous forest biome which includes communities adapted to subpolar conditions.

label: subpolar
definition: A subpolar condition is an environmental condition in which an environmental system receives low, yearly solar irradiance per unit area and is surrounded by large land masses. This results in very cold winters with temperatures potentially falling to around -40 degrees Celsius and summers which last no more than 3 months of the year with a 24-hour average temperature of at least 10 degrees Celsius.

label: freshwater lake biome
definition: A biome which is determined by a freshwater lake.

label: environmental system
definition: A system which has the disposition to environ one or more material entities.

label: mineral deposit
definition: A mineral deposit is a physiographic feature which has unusually high concentrations of one or more minerals.

label: mineral material
definition: A mineral material is an environmental material which is primarily composed of some substance that is naturally occurring, solid and stable at room temperature, representable by a chemical formula, usually abiogenic, and that has an ordered atomic structure.

label: white smoker
definition: A hydrothermal vent found on the ocean floor which emits lighter-hued minerals, such as those containing barium, calcium and silicon. These alkaline hydrothermal vents also continuously generate acetyl thioesters, providing both the starting point for more complex organic molecules and the energy needed to produce them.

label: fluid cline
definition: A fluid front which is 1) thin in comparison to the fluid mass it is a part of and 2) across which a property of that fluid mass varies greatly over short vertical distance, relative to variation across the entire fluid mass.

label: pycnocline
definition: A cline across which the density of a fluid changes rapidly.

label: nutricline within a water body
definition: A nutricline which is part of a water body.

label: obsolete lysocline
definition: A cline within a marine water body where the rate of calcite dissolution changes rapidly with depth. The increase in the rate of calcite dissolution with depth is largely due to the concomitant fall in calcite saturation.

label: seep
definition: A seep is a spring in which water has filtered through permeable earth to the surface.

label: cold seep
definition:
MERGED DEFINITION:
TARGET DEFINITION: A cold seep is a seep in which methane and other hydrocarbon-rich fluids rise to the sea floor.
--------------------
SOURCE DEFINITION: An area of the ocean floor where hydrogen sulfide, methane and other hydrocarbon-rich fluid seepage occurs. Cold seeps are distinct from hydrothermal vents: the former's emissions are of the same temperature as the surrounding seawater, whereas the latter's emissions are super-heated.

label: obsolete vapour
definition: A vapour is an environmental material in the gas phase at a temperature lower than its critical point.

label: hydrothermal seep
definition: A hydrothermal seep is a seep in which diffuse flow of geothermally heated fluids with high methane concentrations. This seep has been proposed as an intermediate between cold seeps and hydrothermal vents.

label: water vapour
definition: Water vapour is a vapour which is the gas phase of water.

label: atmosphere
definition: An atmosphere is a layer of gases surrounding a material body of sufficient mass that is held in place by the gravity of the body.

label: atmospheric water vapour
definition: Atmospheric water vapour is water vapour that is part of an atmosphere.

label: siltstone
definition: A sedimentary rock which is composed mainly of silt. This rock has a grainsize in the silt range, finer than sandstone and coarser than claystones.

label: claystone
definition: A clastic sedimentary rock which is composed primarily of clay sized particles.

label: clastic sedimentary rock
definition: Clastic sedimentary rocks are sedimentary rocks that are composed of silicate minerals and rock fragments that were transported by moving fluids. Clastic rocks are composed largely of quartz, feldspar, rock (lithic) fragments, clay minerals, and mica; numerous other minerals may be present as accessories and may be important locally.

label: mudstone
definition: A mudstone is a clastic sedimentary rock which contains a mixture of at least one third of silt- and one third of clay-sized particles.

label: lime mudstone
definition: Lime mudstone is a limestone which is primarily composed of either clay-size or both silt-size and clay-size detrital (transported) carbonate grains.

label: slate
definition: Slate is a metamorphic rock which is fine-grained, foliated, homogeneous, Slates are derived from clastic sedimentary rocks.

label: structural basin
definition: A structural basin is a geological depression formed by tectonic warping of previously flat lying rock strata.

label: ecoregion
definition: A large unit of land or water containing a geographically distinct assemblage of species, natural communities, and environmental conditions.

label: water ice
definition: Ice is water frozen into a solid state. It can appear transparent or opaque bluish-white color, depending on the presence of impurities or air inclusions. The addition of other materials such as soil may further alter its appearance.

label: pingo scar
definition: A depression caused by the collapse of a pingo.

label: ice lens
definition: An ice mass which is formed when moisture, diffused within soil or rock, accumulates and freezes in a localized zone, wedging soil or rock apart.

label: ecozone
definition: Ecozones delineate large areas of a planetary surface within which organisms have been evolving in relative isolation over long periods of time, separated from one another by geographic features, such as oceans, broad deserts, or high mountain ranges, that constitute barriers to migration.

label: layer
definition: A layer is a quantity of some material which is spatially continuous, has comparable thickness, and usually covers some surface.

label: sedimentary stratum
definition: A stratum is a layer which is composed of sedimentary rock or soil with internally consistent characteristics that distinguish it from other layers.

label: lake layer
definition: A layer which is part of a lake.

label: amictic lake
definition: A lake which is permanently covered by ice, does not mix, and exhibit inverse cold water stratification whereby water temperature increases with depth below the ice surface.

label: holomictic lake
definition: A holomictic lake is a lake which mixes at least once per year. Mixing is caused by a uniform temperature distribution from the upper to lower layers of the lake.

label: dimictic lake
definition: A dimitic lake is a holomictic lake which mixes from top to bottom during two mixing periods each year. Mixing typically occurs during the spring and autumn, when the lake is "isothermal" (i.e., at the same temperature from the top to the bottom). At this time the water throughout the lake is about 4C, and, in the absence of any temperature or density differences, the lake readily mixes from top to bottom. These lakes are common in regions with temperate climates.

label: polymictic lake
definition: A polymictic lake is a holomictic lake which is too shallow to allow thermal stratification and which can mix from top to bottom through the ice-free period of the year.

label: monomictic lake
definition: A monomictic  lake is a holomictic lake which mixes from top to bottom during one mixing period each year.

label: cold monomictic lake
definition: A monomictic lake which is covered by ice throughout much of the year and only mixes when its surface ice melts and the lake lacks thermal stratification.

label: warm monomictic lake
definition: A monomictic lake which does not freeze and is thermally stratified throughout most of the year, only mixing in winter when cooler temperatures ease stratification.

label: cold polymictic lake
definition: A cold polymictic lake is a polymictic lake which is covered by ice in winter.

label: warm polymictic lake
definition: A warm polymictic lake is a polymictic lake which is not covered by ice at any point during the year.

label: ice mass
definition: A mass of water ice.

label: crevice
definition: A deep fissure in rock.

label: marine layer
definition: A layer that is part of a marine water body.

label: dry lake bed
definition: A lake bed which is dry. That is, the bed of a dry lake.

label: freshwater river
definition: A river where fresh water flows.

label: continental margin
definition: A slope which is part of the seafloor, descends from the continental crust to the oceanic crust, and comprises the continental shelf, continental slope, and continental rise.

label: Taylor column
definition: A Taylor column is a column of deflected fluid flow which is formed in a perturbed, rotating fluid, is parallel to the axis of rotation, and extends above the obstacle perturbing the fluid in a rigid manner.

label: atmospheric Taylor column
definition: An atmospheric Taylor column is a Taylor column that is formed in the atmosphere. Atmospheric Taylor columns often form above islands resulting in vortex streets in the atmosphere.

label: estuarine water
definition: Brackish water which is part of an estuary.

label: outcrop
definition: A portion of environmental material which protrudes through a surface layer.

label: endolithic environment
definition: An endolithic environment is an environment that exists within solid rock.

label: high pressure environment
definition: A high pressure environment is an environment in which all material entities are exposed to a high ratio of force per unit area.

label: high temperature environment
definition: A high temperature environment is an environment in which material entities are exposed to increased levels of heat radiation or which have molecules or atoms moving randomly with increased levels of average kinietic energy.

label: freshwater environment
definition: An aquatic environment which is determined by freshwater.

label: saline water environment
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by saline water.

label: extraterrestrial environment
definition: An environmental system which is located beyond the Earth's exosphere and away from the Earth's core.

label: cold environment
definition: An environment which has a lower temperature than some local or global average.

label: haline environment
definition: A haline environment is an environment in which entities are exposed to high concentrations of salt, typically above 2 molar.

label: cultivated environment
definition: A cultivated environment is an environment that has been modified by humans by the preparation of the land, usually for the purposes of growing crops.

label: culturing environment
definition: A culturing environment is an environment which is maintained by humans for the purposes of preparing cell, organ, tissue and plant tissue cultures.

label: anthropogenic environment
definition: An anthropogenic environment is an environmental system which is the product of human activity.

label: high osmolarity environment
definition: A high osmolarity environment is an environment in which entities are exposed to high concentrations of solutes.

label: acidic environment
definition: An acidic environment is an environment in which material entities are exposed to a low pH.

label: alkaline environment
definition: An alkaline environment is an environment in which entities are exposed to high pH, typically greater than a pH of 9.

label: aquatic environment
definition: An environment whose dynamics are strongly influenced by water.

label: extreme high temperature environment
definition: An extreme high temperature environment is a high temperature environment in which entities are exposed to temperatures above 80 degrees Celsius.

label: rocky slope
definition: A rocky slope is a slope which has a surface primarily composed of rock.

label: marine environment
definition: A marine environment and enviroment which is determined by a marine water body.

label: sea water environment
definition: An environmental system determined by seawater.

label: brackish water environment
definition: An environment determined by the presence of brackish water.

label: atmospheric boundary layer
definition: The atmospheric boundary layer is the lowest layer of an atmosphere which is strongly influenced by its contact with a planetary surface with strong vertical mixing and in which physical quantities such as flow velocity, temperature, and moisture display rapid fluctuations (turbulence).

label: planetary surface
definition: A planetary surface is a surface layer where the solid or liquid material of a planet comes into contact with an atmosphere or outer space.

label: aquatic layer
definition: A layer in a water mass, itself composed primarily of water.

label: deep chlorophyll maximum layer
definition: A subsurface layer in a water body, typically an ocean or lake, in which chlorophyll concentrations reach their maximum.

label: strand swamp
definition: A strand swamp is a swamp that forms linear drainage channels on flatlands.

label: dome swamp
definition: A dome swamp is a swamp which occurs in a depression where deeper waters at the centre of the swamp allow  trees to grow taller relative to those in shallower regions of the depression. This creates a dome-like shape.

label: cypress dome
definition: A cypress dome swamp is a dome swamp which has a plant community dominated by Cupressaceae, often swamp cypresses. Swamp cypresses typically belong to the genus Taxodium or the species Glyptostrobus pensilis and Actinostrobus pyramidalis.

label: cypress strand swamp
definition: A cypress strand swamp is a strand swamp which has a plant community dominated by Cupressaceae, often swamp cypresses. Swamp cypresses typically belong to the genus Taxodium or the species Glyptostrobus pensilis and Actinostrobus pyramidalis.

label: cypress swamp
definition: A cypress swamp is a swamp which has a plant community dominated by Cupressaceae, often swamp cypresses. Swamp cypresses typically belong to the genus Taxodium or the species Glyptostrobus pensilis and Actinostrobus pyramidalis.

label: gravelly slope
definition: A gravelly slope is a slope which has a surface primarily composed of gravel.

label: hillside
definition: A hillside is a slope that is part of a hill.

label: talus slope
definition: A talus slope is a slope which has a surface layer composed of scree.

label: understory
definition: An understory is a layer of plant life which grows below the canopy without penetrating it.

label: shrub layer
definition: A shrub layer is a layer of vegetation in a woodland or forest consisting of low, woody vegetation of frutescent form.

label: herb and fern layer
definition: A herb and fern layer is a layer of a forest or woodland which is composed of all vascular plant life that are one metre or less in height.

label: polar biome
definition: A biome which is subject to polar climatic conditions.

label: alpine
definition: An altitudinal condition which inheres in a bearer by virtue of the bearer having a monthly mean temperature is less than 10 degrees Celsius and being located at altitudes above the tree line and below the snowline.

label: subalpine
definition: An altitudinal condition which inheres in a bearer by virtue of the bearer being located at an altitude immediately below the tree line of an elevation.

label: montane
definition: An altitudinal condition which inheres in a bearer by virtue of the bearer being located at an altitude between mid-altitude forests and the tree line.

label: altitudinal condition
definition: An altitudinal condition is an environmental condition in which ranges of factors such as temperature, humidity, soil composition, solar irradiation, and tree density vary with ranges in altitude.

label: nival
definition: An altitudinal condition which inheres in a bearer by virtue of the bearer having extremely limited vegetation cover, silica-enriched soils, and ground cover dominated by snow and ice at altitudes above the snowline.

label: upper montane
definition: An upper montane condition is a montane condition in which an altitude range falls immediately below the tree line.

label: lower montane
definition: A lower montane condition is a montane condition in which an altitude range falls immediately above mid-altitude forests.

label: montane conifer woodland
definition: A montane conifer woodland is a conifer woodland which is located within an altitude range that falls between mid-altitude forests and the tree line.

label: maize field
definition: A field  used for the cultivation of corn or related crop plants.

label: root matter
definition: An organic material primarily composed of a portion of plant root.

label: autoclaved sand
definition: Autoclaved sand is sand that has been sterlised by exposure to high pressure saturated steam at at least 121 degrees Celsius.

label: obsolete marine mesoscale eddy
definition: A marine mesoscale eddy is a current of marine water which has a typical horizontal diameter of less than 100 km and persists for approximately one month.

label: field
definition: An unbroken expanse (as of ice)

label: marine mesoscale eddy field
definition: A mesoscale eddy field is an expanse of marine water which includes coherent vortices, as well as a rich cascade of other structures such as filaments, squirts and spirals and is characterized by temperature and salinity anomalies with associated flow anomalies that are nearly in geostrophic balance. Although only the surface expression of mesoscale eddies is visible in satellite images of sea surface height or temperature, they are in fact three dimensional structures that reach down into the pycnocline.

label: ice cap climatic condition
definition: An ice cap climatic condition is a polar condition in which the montly average temperature does not exceed 0 degrees Celsius.

label: vegetation layer
definition: A layer which is determined by a form of vegetation.

label: granite
definition: A portion of granite is a portion of igneous  rock which  is intrusive, felsic, granular, and phaneritic.

label: alkaline water
definition: A portion of alkaline water is a portion of water with a pH greater than 7.

label: acidic water
definition: A portion of acidic water is a portion of water with a pH less than 7.

label: limestone cave
definition: A cave formed in limestone, usually by dissolution of limestone by acidic groundwater.

label: solutional cave
definition: A cave formed by the dissolution of soluble rock or other solid material such as limestone, chalk, dolomite, gypsum, salt or marble.

label: primary cave
definition: A cave formed at the same time as the surrounding rock.

label: inflationary cave
definition: A cave that is formed by the action of pressurised lava pushing against surrounding rock and then draining away.

label: erosional cave
definition: A cave formed by erosion caused by flowing streams carrying rocks or sediments.

label: glacier cave
definition: A glacier cave is a cave formed within or under a glacier.

label: ice cave
definition: An ice cave is a bedrock cave which contains year-round ice formations.

label: talus cave
definition: A talus cave is a cave formed by the openings between large boulders which have fallen into a random heap.

label: anchialine cave
definition: An anchialine cave is a cave which contains an anchialine pool.

label: anchialine pool
definition: An anchialine pool is a landlocked water body with a subterranean connection to the ocean and which has fresh water towards its surface with saline water in its deeper layers.

label: vadose cave
definition: A cave which is within a vadose zone.

label: tundra climatic condition
definition: An tundra climatic condition is a polar condition in which at least one month's average temperature exceeds 0 degrees Celsius.

label: agricultural waste material
definition: Agricultural waste is waste produced as a result of various agricultural operations. It includes manure and other wastes from farms, poultry houses and slaughterhouses; harvest waste; fertilizer run- off from fields; pesticides that enter into water, air or soils; and salt and silt drained from fields.

label: household waste material
definition: Household waste refers to waste material usually generated in the residential environment. Waste with similar characteristics may be generated in other economic activities and can thus be treated and disposed of together with household waste.

label: biological waste material
definition: Biological waste is waste containing mostly natural organic materials (remains of plants, animal excrement, biological sludge from waste-water treatment plants and so forth).

label: dry woodland
definition: A dry woodland is a woodland which occurs in areas of rain shadow in a tropical marine climate,  receives very little rainfall,  typically has rapidly draining soils and trees which have adaptations to dry climates such as thick bark, small leaves, and the disposition to shed their leaves.

label: tropical marine condition
definition: A tropical marine condition is a tropical condition in which the ocean strongly influences the climate and a wet and dry season occur.

label: tropical marine semi-evergreen forest
definition: A semi-evergreen forest is a forest which undergoes a long dry season and, as a consequence, has a two-storey layer structure,  a dry canopy, a leaf litter layer that only decays during moist periods trees with very small leaves or which shed their leaves to conserve water and which flower during the dry season and grow during the wet season.

label: humid subtropical
definition: A humid subtropical condition is a subtropical condition in which an environmental system has hot, humid summers, warm to cool dry winters, and average annual precipitation either evenly distributed throughout the year or marked by a dry season or drying trend during winter

label: arid subtropical
definition: An arid subtropical condition is a subtropical condition in which an environmental system has an annual average temperature near 18.2 degrees Celsius with their coldest month averaging between 2 and 13 degrees Celsius, the absence of regular rainfall, and high humidity.

label: highland subtropical
definition: A highland subtropical condition is a subtropical condition in which increased elevation results in mild summers, cooler winters, and, in some instances,  snowfall associated with montly temperature averages below 22 but above -3 degrees Celsius.

label: oceanic temperate
definition: An oceanic temperate condition is a temperate condition which is strongly influenced by oceans and oceanic winds. Summers are cool and winters are cool, but not cold, and there is little frozen precipitation at lower elevations.

label: continental temperate
definition: A continental temperate condition is a temperate condition which is influenced by large land masses. Summers are warm to hot and winters are often  long, cold, and snowy.

label: cold desert
definition: A cold desert is a desert which has hot summers and cold, dry winters with temperatures below 0 degrees Celsius

label: temperate evergreen needleleaf forest
definition: An evergreen needleleaf forest which is subject to temperate climate patterns.

label: tropical lowland evergreen broadleaf rain forest
definition: A broadleaf forest which is subject to tropical climate patterns with high rainfall, is located in a lowland area, and is dominated by plants which retain their leaves throughout the year.

label: temperate deciduous broadleaf forest
definition: A deciduous broadleaf forest which is subject to temperate climate patterns.

label: temperate deciduous needleleaf forest
definition: A deciduous needleleaf forest which is subject to temperate climate patterns.

label: tropical deciduous broadleaf forest
definition: A deciduous broadleaf forest which is subject to tropical climate patterns.

label: tropical semi-deciduous broadleaf forest
definition: A semi-deciduous broadleaf forest which is subject to tropical climate patterns.

label: temperate mixed broadleaf forest
definition: A temperate mixed forest which has communities of trees composed primarily of species with broad leaves.

label: temperate mixed needleleaf forest
definition: A temperate mixed forest which has communities of trees composed primarily of species with needle-like leaves (e.g. conifers).

label: tropical upper montane forest
definition: A montane forest which is located in a region subject to tropical climate patterns modulated by sufficient elevation to encounter upper montane climate patterns.

label: tropical lower montane forest
definition: A montane forest which is located in a region subject to tropical climate patterns modulated by sufficient elevation to encounter lower montane climatic patterns.

label: tropical freshwater swamp forest
definition: A freshwater swamp forest which is subject to tropical climate patterns.

label: temperate sclerophyllous dry forest
definition: A sclerophyllous forest which is subject to temperate climate patterns.

label: tropical sclerophyllous dry forest
definition: A sclerophyllous forest which is subject to tropical climate patterns.

label: temperate broadleaf evergreen forest
definition: A broadleaf evergreen forest which is subject to temperate climate patterns.

label: temperate freshwater swamp forest
definition: A freshwater swamp forest which is subject to temperate climate patterns.

label: tropical needleleaf forest
definition: A needleleaf forest which is subject to tropical climate patterns.

label: tropical mixed needleleaf forest
definition: A mixed needleleaf forest which has communities of trees composed primarily of species with needle-like leaves (e.g. conifers).

label: tropical mixed broadleaf forest
definition: A tropical mixed broadleaf forest which has communities of trees composed primarily of species with broad leaves.

label: manufactured plastic
definition: A (portion of) plastic is an (portion of) anthropogenic environmental material including any of numerous organic synthetic or processed materials which are primarily composed of thermoplastic or thermosetting polymers of high molecular weight.

label: respirable suspended particulate matter
definition: A portion of respirable suspended particulate matter is a form of particulate matter composed primarily of solid particles each with a diameter of 10 micrometers or less.

label: snow
definition: Snow is an environmental material which is primarily composed of flakes of crystalline water ice.

label: littoral zone
definition: An aquatic environment which is the part of a sea, lake, or river that is close to the shore.

label: environmental zone
definition: A site which has its extent determined by the presence or influence of one or more components of an environmental system or the processes occurring therein.

label: freshwater littoral zone
definition: A freshwater littoral zone is a littoral zone which extends offshore from the shore of a freshwater body of water to the limit of occupancy of rooted plants.

label: marine eulittoral zone
definition: The eulittoral zone extends from the spring high tide line, which is rarely inundated, to the spring low tide line, which is rarely not inundated. The wave action and turbulence of recurring tides shapes and reforms cliffs, gaps, and caves, offering a huge range of habitats for sedentary organisms.

label: infralittoral zone
definition: A zone which is part of the sublittoral zone and is dominated by algae. This zone usually extends up to five metres below the low water mark.

label: circalittoral zone
definition: A zone which is part of the sublittoral zone and is dominated by sessile animals such as oysters. This zone usually begins at a depth greater than the infralittoral zone.

label: old plant
definition: A whole plant which is relatively old

label: young plant
definition: A whole plant which is relatively young.

label: fine respirable suspended particulate matter
definition: A portion of fine respirable suspended particulate matter is a form of particulate matter composed primarily of solid particles each with a diameter of 2.5 micrometers or less.

label: ultrafine respirable suspended particulate matter
definition: A portion of fine respirable suspended particulate matter is a form of particulate matter composed primarily of solid particles each with a diameter of  100 nanometers or less.

label: house
definition: A house is a building that provides a dwelling-place for a living entity.

label: domestic garden
definition: A garden that is associated with a human house. This association is generally one of spatial proximity or parthood.|

label: building part
definition: A building part is a construction which is part of a building.

label: indoor kitchen
definition: An indoor kitchen is a room or part of a room primarily used  for cooking or food preparation, but which may have other funcitons such as dining, food storage, dishwashing, or laundry.

label: bathroom
definition: A bathroom is a room which contains a washbasin or other fixture, such as a shower or bath, used for bathing by humans.

label: living room
definition: A living room is a room in a human house which is used for social and domestic leisure activities.

label: patio
definition: A patio is a paved outdoor area, adjacent to a human house, and used for dining or recreation.

label: indoor toilet
definition: An indoor toilet is a room which contains a sanitation fixture used primarily for the disposal of human urine and faeces.

label: room
definition: A building part which is separated from other building parts by one or more interior walls and, optionally, outdoor areas by one or more exterior walls.

label: carbon nanotube enriched soil
definition: A portion of carbon nanotube enriched soil is a portion of soil with elevated levels of carbon nanotubes.

label: area of rocky shore
definition: A rocky shore is an intertidal area of a seacoast where solid rock is the predominant substrate.

label: burrow
definition: A burrow is a hole or tunnel excavated into the ground by an animal to create a space suitable for habitation, temporary refuge, or as a byproduct of locomotion

label: broadleaf forest
definition: A forest biome which contains densely packed populations or communities of broadleaf trees, strongly limiting light penetration to the forest floor.

label: mixed forest
definition: A forest ecosystem which contains densely packed populations or communities of broadleaf and coniferous trees, strongly limiting light penetration to the forest floor.

label: waterborne particulate matter
definition: Waterborne particulate matter is a form of particulate matter in which small portions of solid material are surrounded by water.

label: lava field
definition: A lava field is an expanse of flat-lying lava flows. Such features are generally composed of highly fluid basalt lava, and can extend for tens or even hundreds of miles across the underlying terrain.

label: lava flow
definition: A lava flow is a moving outpouring of lava, which is created during a non-explosive effusive eruption.

label: andesite
definition: Andesite is an extrusive igneous, volcanic rock, of intermediate composition, with aphanitic to porphyritic texture. In a general sense, it is the intermediate type between basalt and dacite, and ranges from 57 to 63 percent silicon dioxide as illustrated in TAS diagrams. The mineral assemblage is typically dominated by plagioclase plus pyroxene and/or hornblende. Magnetite, zircon, apatite, ilmenite, biotite, and garnet are common accessory minerals. Alkali feldspar may be present in minor amounts.

label: dacite
definition: Dacite is an igneous, volcanic rock. It has an aphanitic to porphyritic texture and is intermediate in composition between andesite and rhyolite.  Dacite consists mostly of plagioclase feldspar with biotite, hornblende, and pyroxene (augite and/or enstatite). It has quartz as rounded, corroded phenocrysts, or as an element of the ground-mass. The plagioclase ranges from oligoclase to andesine and labradorite. Sanidine occurs, although in small proportions, in some dacites, and when abundant gives rise to rocks that form transitions to the rhyolites.

label: salt mass
definition: An accumulation of a salt, typically sodium chloride.

label: disturbed ecosystem
definition: An ecosystem which has been subject to a perturbation, that is, the ecosystem has undergone a pronounced change in response to a change in environmental conditions or other perturbation.

label: ravine
definition: A ravine is a small, narrow, steep-sided valley that is larger than a gully and smaller than a canyon and that is usually worn by running water.

label: roadside
definition: An environmental zone of varying area which is adjacent to a road.

label: mixed grassland
definition: A grassland which contains a mixture of tall and short grasses.

label: wet meadow ecosystem
definition: A wet meadow is a type of wetland with soils that are saturated with water for part or all of the growing season.

label: salt glacier
definition: A mass of salt which has erupted onto a planetary surface, usually through sedimentary rock.

label: atmospheric carbon dioxide
definition: Atmospheric carbon dioxide is an environmental material composed of carbon dioxide in its gaseous form present in an atmosphere.

label: environmental disposition
definition: A disposition which is realised by an environmental system or system parts thereof.

label: carbon pooling disposition
definition: The disposition of an environmental system to sequester and store carbon.

label: carbon dioxide pooling disposition
definition: The disposition of an environment to sequester carbon dioxide, subsequently storing the carbon component thereof.

label: material pooling disposition
definition: The disposition of an environmental system to sequester and store some material entity.

label: concrete masonry unit
definition: A concrete masonry unit is a large, rectangular masonry unit primarily composed of concrete.

label: masonry unit
definition: A masonry unit is a solid piece of material, usually with a regular shape, used as a component in the construction of buildings. Masonry units are usually composed of brick, stone, marble, granite, travertine, limestone, cast stone, concrete block, glass block, stucco, tile, or cob.

label: concrete
definition: Concrete is a composite material composed of an aggregate bonded together with a fluid cement which hardens over time.

label: asphalt concrete
definition: Asphaltic concrete is a concrete which uses refined asphalt as a cement.

label: asphalt
definition: Asphalt also known as bitumen is a sticky, black, and highly viscous liquid or semi-solid form of petroleum.

label: refined asphalt
definition: Refined asphalt is a sticky, black, and highly viscous liquid or semi-solid with a boiling point above 500 degrees Celsius, obtained from the fractional distillation of crude oil.

label: masonry cement
definition: Masonry cement is a substance used in construction that has the disposition to set and harden and thus may be used to bind materials together.

label: hydraulic cement
definition: Hydraulic cement is a masonry cement which contains activated aluminium silicates or pozzolans, such as fly ash, allowing it to set in wet conditions or underwater.

label: non-hydraulic cement
definition: Non-hydraulic cement is a cement which sets by reacting with carbon dioxide in the air and will not set in wet conditions or underwater. It is susceptible to attack by aggresive chemicals after setting.

label: building wall
definition: Building walls are bulding parts which serve to support roofs, floors and ceilings; enclose a space as part of the building envelope; give buildings form; and to provide shelter and security.

label: boundary wall
definition: A boundary wall is a constructed barrier which is usually opaque, constructed from masonry, and of greater structural strength than a fence.

label: constructed barrier
definition: A constructed barrier is a freestanding wall, berm, or fence built to limit movement of entities across a boundary.

label: fence
definition: A fence is a constructed barrier which is  generally of lighter construction than a wall and used to provide visual sectioning of spaces.

label: exterior wall
definition: An exterior wall is a building wall which separates the interior of a building from the buildings surrounding environment.

label: building envelope
definition:
A building envelope is a building part composed of those building parts which physically separate the interior of a building from its surrounding environment.
The building envelope provides resistance to air, water, heat, light, and noise transfer. The three basic elements of a building envelope are a weather barrier, air barrier, and thermal barrier.

label: building roof
definition: A roof is the covering on the uppermost part of a building which provides protection from animals and weather, notably rain, but also heat, wind and sunlight. A roof is also the framing or structure which supports the covering

label: thatch
definition: Thatch is material composed of dry vegetation such as straw, water reed, sedge (Cladium mariscus), rushes, or heather.

label: brick material
definition: A portion of brick material is a material derived from a brick which is composed of  kneaded clay-bearing soil, expanded clay aggregate, sand and lime, or concrete that has been fire-hardened or air-dried.

label: brick
definition: A brick is a masonry unit which is composed of kneaded clay-bearing soil, expanded clay aggregate, sand and lime, or concrete material, fire-hardened or air-dried.

label: plaster
definition: Plaster is a building material which has the disposition to harden when it reacts with water, liberating heat through crystallization. Plaster is manufactured as a dry powder and is mixed with water to form a paste when used.

label: gypsum plaster
definition: Gypsum plaster is a plaster which is formed by partially dehydrating gypsum by heating it to approximately 150 degrees Celsius and grinding the product into a powder. Gypsum anhydride - formed by heating gypsum above 200 degrees Celsius - may also be used as plaster.

label: lime plaster
definition: Lime plaster is a plaster which is primarily composed of calcium hydroxide and an inert filler (such as sand). Coversion of the calcium hydroxide to calcium carbonate through a reaction with carbon dioxide in the air causes the plaster to set.

label: glass
definition: Glass is an amorphous (non-crystalline) solid which is often transparent.

label: silica-based glass
definition: Silica-based glass is a glass composed primarily of silicon dioxide, the primary constituent of sand.

label: soda-lime glass
definition: Soda-lime glass is a silica-based glass which is composed of approximately 75% silicon dioxide, with sodium oxide and calcium oxide consituting most of its remaining composition.

label: flat glass
definition: Flat glass is a soda-lime glass which is composed of approximately 73% silicon dioxide (silica), 14% sodium oxide, 9% calcium oxide, 4% magnesium oxide, 0.15% aluminium oxide, 0.03% potassium oxide, 0.02% titanum dioxide, and 0.01% iron III oxide.

label: container glass
definition: Container glass is a soda-lime glass which is composed of approximately 74% silicon dioxide (silica), 13% sodium oxide, 10.5% calcium oxide, 1.3% aluminium oxide, 0.3% potassium oxide, 0.2% sulphur trioxide, 0.2% magnesium oxide,  0.04% iron III oxide, and 0.01%  titanum dioxide.

label: quartz glass
definition: Quartz glass is a glass which is composed of silica in amorphous (non-crystalline) form.

label: building floor
definition: A building floor is a surface layer which is part of a building and used for walking.

label: brick building floor
definition: A brick building floor is a building floor that is composed primarily of brick material or is built from bricks.

label: wooden building floor
definition: A wooden building floor is a building floor that is composed primarily of wood.

label: concrete building floor
definition: A concrete building floor is a building floor that is composed primarily of concrete

label: sandy building floor
definition: A sandy building floor is a building floor that is composed primarily of sand.

label: glass building floor
definition: A glass building floor is a building floor which is composed primarily of glass.

label: dung building floor
definition: A dung building floor is a building floor which is composed primarily of dried animal feces.

label: stone building floor
definition: A stone building floor is a building floor that is composed primarily of rock.

label: thatched exterior wall
definition: A thatched exterior wall is an exterior wall that is composed primarily of thatch.

label: stone exterior wall
definition: A stone exterior wall is an exterior wall that is composed primarily of rock.

label: straw exterior wall
definition: A straw exterior wall is an exterior wall that is composed primarily of straw.

label: mud exterior wall
definition: A mud exterior wall is an exterior wall that is composed primarily of mud.

label: pole
definition: A solid, cylindrical object or column with its length greater than its diameter.

label: pole-reinforced mud exterior wall
definition: A pole-reinforced mud exterior wall is a mud exterior wall which is supported and reinforced by poles.

label: brick exterior wall
definition: A brick exterior wall is an exterior wall that is built from bricks.

label: burnt brick
definition: A burnt brick is a brick which has been dried at an elvated temperature in a kiln, furnace, or with similar technology .

label: unburnt brick
definition: An unburnt brick is a brick which has been air dried rather than dried at an elvated temperature in a kiln, furnace, or with similar technology .

label: burnt-brick exterior wall
definition: A burnt brick exterior wall is an exterior wall that is built from burnt bricks.

label: unburnt-brick exterior wall
definition: An unburnt brick exterior wall is an exterior wall that is built from unburnt bricks.

label: salt dome
definition: A dome-shaped mass of salt formed when a thick bed of evaporite minerals (mainly salt, or halite) found at depth intrudes vertically into surrounding rock strata, forming a diapir.

label: concrete exterior wall
definition: A concrete exterior wall is an exterior wall that is composed primarily of concrete.

label: iron sheet
definition: An iron sheet is a mass of iron which has been forged into a roughly planar form of less than 6 millimetres in thickness.

label: sheet-iron exterior wall
definition: A sheet-iron exterior wall is an exterior wall that is built from sheets of iron.

label: sheet-iron building roof
definition: A sheet-iron building roof is a building roof that is built from sheets of iron.

label: thatched building roof
definition: A thatched building roof is a building roof that is built by thatching (or out of thatch).

label: wooden building roof
definition: A wooden building roof is a building roof that is built from wood.

label: asbestos building roof
definition: An asbestos building roof is a building roof that is built from asbestos.

label: tile
definition: A tile is a manufactured piece of hard-wearing material such as ceramic, stone, metal, or even glass, generally used for covering roofs, floors, walls, showers, or other objects such as tabletops. Alternatively, tile can sometimes refer to similar units made from lightweight materials such as perlite, wood, and mineral wool, typically used for wall and ceiling applications.

label: tiled building roof
definition: A tile building roof is a building roof that is built using tiles.

label: toilet fixture
definition: A fixture which is used primarily for the collection and, in some cases, disposal of human urine and feces.

label: pit latrine
definition: A pit latrine is a latrine which is constructed by digging a hole in the ground.

label: diapir
definition: A diapir is a type of geologic intrusion in which a more mobile and ductily deformable material is forced into brittle overlying rocks due to its higher buoyancy.

label: latrine
definition: A latrine is a toilet which is of simple construction (relative to a flush or chemical toilet) and typically intended for communal use.

label: latrine slab
definition: A latrine slab is a  broad, flat, thick piece of solid material (typically stone or concrete) used as the floor of a latrine and which includes a hole through which excreta are deposited into a latrine pit.

label: batholith
definition: A batholith is an area of mostly continuous plutonic (igneous intrusive) rock that covers an area larger than 100 square kilometers, formed in the planetary crust, and exposed by erosion. On Earth, Batholiths are almost always made mostly of felsic or intermediate rock-types, such as granite, quartz monzonite, or diorite.

label: latrine pit
definition: A latrine pit is an artificial hole or cavity in the ground used to collect human excreta.

label: pit latrine with slab floor
definition: A pit latrine with a slab floor is a pit latrine which has a latrine slab as a floor.

label: outhouse
definition: An outhouse is a small structure, separate from a main building, which covers a pit latrine or a dry toilet.

label: rock intrusion
definition: An intrusion which is primarily composed of rock which has been formed within a pre-existing fracture in a larger mass of rock.

label: flush toilet fixture
definition: A toilet fixture which uses water to flush liquid and solid excreta into a sewage containment or processing facility through a drainpipe.

label: dry toilet fixture
definition: A toilet fixture which uses little to no water; excreta is removed manually or composted in situ.

label: chemical toilet fixture
definition: A chemical toilet fixture is a toilet fixture which uses chemicals to deodorise and treat excreta which is stored in the fixture.

label: ventilated improved pit latrine
definition: A ventilated improved pit latrine is a pit latrine which includes a vent pipe fitted to the pit with a flyscreen covering the pipe's outlet. Air currents moving across the outlet of the vent pipe create a vaccum which draws odors out of the latrine's superstructure.

label: covered latrine
definition: A covered latrine is a building which comprises a latrine sheltered by an outhouse.

label: covered pit latrine
definition: A covered pit latrine is a building which comprises a pit latrine sheltered by an outhouse.

label: covered pit latrine with slab floor
definition: A covered pit latrine with slab is a building which comprises a pit latrine with a slab floor sheltered by an outhouse.

label: pour-flush toilet fixture
definition: A flush toilet fixture into which water is manually poured to dispose of excreta.

label: pour-flush pit latrine
definition: A pit latrine which includes a water seal (U-trap or siphon) used over one or two offset pits instead of a plain hole or seat. Water is manually poured through the trap to flush excreta into the latrine pit.

label: factory
definition: A factory (previously manufactory) or manufacturing plant is an industrial site, usually consisting of buildings and machinery, or more commonly a complex having several buildings, where workers manufacture goods or operate machines processing one product into another.

label: atmospheric ozone
definition: Atmospheric ozone is an environmental material primarily composed of ozone in its gaseous form and present in an atmosphere.

label: stratosphere
definition: The layer of the atmosphere which is sandwiched between the troposphere and mesosphere. Of the energy that reaches the Earth from the sun, only 3% is absorbed in the stratosphere, but that includes the vitally important process of absorption of ultraviolet radiation by the stratospheric ozone layer. The stratosphere is cloudless and dust free, and almost unaffected by the turbulent conditions of the underlying level of the atmosphere. (Source: WRIGHT)

label: mesosphere
definition: The mesosphere is part of the earth's atmosphere which is between the stratosphere and the thermosphere in which temperature decreases with altitude to the atmosphere's absolute minimum

label: troposphere
definition: The lowest of the concentric layers of the atmosphere, occurring between the Earth's surface and the tropopause. It is the zone where atmospheric turbulence is at its greatest and where the bulk of the Earth's weather is generated. It contains almost all the water vapour and aerosols and three-quarters of the total gaseous mass of the atmosphere. Throughout the troposphere temperature decreases with height at a mean rate of 6.5C/km and the whole zone is capped by either an inversion of temperature or an isothermal layer at the tropopause. (Source: WHIT)

label: thermosphere
definition: The thermosphere is a part of the earth's atmosphere that begins at about 50 miles (80 kilometers) above the earth's surface, extends to outer space, and is characterized by steadily increasing temperature with height

label: ozone layer
definition: The ozone layer is a layer of gases in the stratosphere which contains high concentrations of ozone gas relative to other parts of the atmosphere.

label: atmospheric layer
definition: A layer that is part of the atmosphere.

label: boundary layer
definition: A boundary layer is a layer of fluid in the immediate vicinity of a bounding surface where the effects of viscosity are significant enough to distort the surrounding non-viscous flow.

label: ionosphere
definition: The ionosphere is a layer of the Earth's atmosphere which extends from about 60 to 1,000 kilometers above the planetary surface and is ionised by solar radiation. It includes the thermosphere and parts of the mesosphere and exosphere.

label: exosphere
definition: The exosphere is an atmospheric layer where molecules are gravitationally bound to a planetary body, but where their density is too low for them to behave as a gas by colliding with each other. In the case of bodies with substantial atmospheres, such as Earth's atmosphere, the exosphere is the uppermost layer, where the atmosphere thins out and merges with interplanetary space. It is located directly above the thermosphere.

label: glaze ice layer
definition: A glaze ice layer is a smooth, transparent and homogeneous ice layer which coats some surface and which is formed when freezing rain or drizzle hits that surface.

label: eutrophic lake
definition: A lake which has nutrient-rich water.

label: composting toilet
definition: A composting toilet fixture is a dry toilet fixture in which managed, aerobic decomposition converts human excreta into organic matter suitable for the fertilisation or amendment of soils.

label: paraffin oil
definition: A fuel oil which is 1) composed primarily of alkanes having between 5-15 carbon atoms with the general formula CnH2n+2, 2) is generally odorless or has only a slight odor, 3) produces only small amounts of soot relative to other fuel oils, 4) is highly refined.

label: natural gas
definition: Natural gas is a hydrocarbon gas mixture consisting primarily of methane, but commonly includes varying amounts of other higher alkanes and sometimes a usually lesser percentage of carbon dioxide, nitrogen, and/or hydrogen sulfide. Natural gas is a fossil fuel formed when layers of buried plants and gases are exposed to intense heat and pressure over thousands of years.

label: liquefied petroleum gas
definition: Liquified petroleum gas or liquid petroleum gas (LPG or LP gas), also referred to as simply propane or butane, are flammable mixtures of hydrocarbon gases used as fuel in heating appliances, cooking equipment, and vehicles.

label: hydrocarbon gas
definition: A gas that is primarily composed of hydrocarbon molecules.

label: compressed natural gas
definition: Compressed natural gas is a natural gas stored at high pressures, typically 2025 Megapascals.

label: biogas
