definition: A rainbow which forms through the interaction of sunlight with the water droplets which constitute fog or clouds; light is diffracted by these droplets such that the photometeor appears almost white with faint reds on the sky-facing side and faint blues on the planet-facing side of the bow.

label: glory
definition: A photometeor which is formed by wave interference of light refracted within water droplets which constitute mist or clouds and consists of one or more concentric, successively dimmer rings, each of which has red wavelengths distant to the glory's centre and blue wavelengths towards the centre.

label: halo
definition: A photometeor which is produced by light that is reflected, refracted, and dispersed by ice crystals, capable of acting as prisms and mirrors, suspended in an astronomical body's atmosphere.

label: hypereutrophic water
definition: Water which has a very high concentration of nutrients.

label: hypereutrophic lake
definition: A lake which is composed primarily of water with very high nutrient concentrations.

label: hypersaline lake
definition: A lake which is primarily composed of water with a concentration of dissolved salts greater than that of ocean water.

label: humic lake
definition: A lake which is composed primarily water with high concentrations of humic substances and organic acids, resulting in brown- or tea-coloured colouration.

label: natural lake
definition: A lake which has formed as the result of processes that are not or are only minimally driven by human activity.

label: radiation
definition: A process during which energy is emitted or transmitted in the form of waves or particles through space or a material medium.

label: particle radiation
definition: A radiation process during which energy is transmitted or emitted by means of fast-moving subatomic particles.

label: particle beam radiation
definition: A particle radiation process during which subatomic particles move in the same direction.

label: electromagnetic radiation
definition: A radiation process during which waves (or their quanta, photons) of the electromagnetic field propagate (radiate) through space carrying electromagnetic energy.

label: acoustic radiation
definition: A radiation process during which mechanical waves generated by oscillations radiate through an environmental material.

label: sediment permeated by freshwater
definition: Sediment which has its porespace filled by water which has very low levels of sodium chloride and/or other salts.

label: fecal environment
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by feces.

label: environment determined by a metazoan secretion
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by a bodily secretion of a metazoan.

label: environment determined by a plant substance
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by a substance produced by a plant.

label: environment determined by a biofilm on a plant surface
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by a biofilm on the surface of a plant.

label: digestive tract environment
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by a digestive tract.

label: environment determined by a biofilm on an animal surface
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by a biofilm on the surface of a animal.

label: environment determined by a biofilm on a fungal surface
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by a biofilm on the surface of a fungus.

label: sediment permeated by saline water
definition: Sediment which has its porespace filled by water with increased levels of sodium chloride and other salts.

label: slightly saline water
definition: Water which contains a slightly increased concentration of dissolved salts, relative to their concentration in freshwater.

label: moderately saline water
definition: Water which contains a moderately increased concentration of dissolved salts, relative to their concentration in freshwater.

label: highly saline water
definition: Water which contains a highly increased concentration of dissolved salts, relative to their concentration in freshwater.

label: saline environment
definition: An environment which is determined by materials which bear significant concentrations of salts.

label: fungi-associated environment
definition: An environmental system determined by a fungal structure.

label: sterile water environment
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by sterile water.

label: hypersaline water environment
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by hypersaline water.

label: soil environment
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by soil.

label: oceanic subsurface zone
definition: A region which overlaps parts of one or more planetary structural layers which are located below an oceanic plate.

label: planetary subsurface environment
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by the subsurface zone of a planet.

label: non-saline planetary subsurface environment
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by those parts of a planetary subsurface zone which are not saline.

label: sediment environment
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by sediment.

label: non-saline sediment environment
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by sediment permeated by non-saline water.

label: saline sediment environment
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by sediment permeated by saline water.

label: environment determined by a biofilm on a non-saline surface
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by a biofilm on a surface which is exposed to non-saline materials.

label: aerosol environment
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by an aerosol.

label: saline aerosol environment
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by a saline aerosol.

label: non-saline aerosol environment
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by an aerosol with a low concentration of dissolved solutes.

label: environment associated with an animal part or small animal
definition: An environmental system determined by part of a living or dead animal, or a whole small animal.

label: environment determined by a biofilm on a saline surface
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by a biofilm on a surface which is exposed to saline materials.

label: environment associated with a plant part or small plant
definition: An environmental system determined by part of a living or dead plant, or a whole small plant.

label: environment associated with a fungal tissue
definition: An environmental system determined by part of a living or dead fungus.

label: mock community culture
definition: A cell culture which is composed of a microbial community of known composition.

label: single strain cell culture
definition: A cell culture which is composed of a single population of bacterial or archaeal cells.

label: caldera lake
definition: A lake which is contained within a caldera.

label: crater lake
definition: A lake contained within a crater.

label: oxic water
definition: Water which has an appreciable concentration of dissolved oxygen.

label: hypoxic water
definition: Water which has low levels of dissolved oxygen.

label: meteorite lake
definition: A lake which is contained in a crater formed by a meteorite impact.

label: impact between astronomical bodies
definition: An impact event is a collision between astronomical bodies.

label: meterorite impact
definition: An impact event during which a meteoroid collides with another astronomical body.

label: meteoroid
definition: An astronomical body which is composed of rocky or metallic materials and is considerably smaller than asteroids.

label: metallic material
definition: A material which is composed primarily of one or more pure metals and which shows their properties.

label: impact crater lake
definition: A lake which is contained in a crater formed by an impact event.

label: impact crater
definition: A crater which was formed as a result of the impact of one astronomical body on another.

label: anoxic lake
definition: A lake which is primarily composed of anoxic water.

label: lake with an anoxic hypolimnion
definition: A lake which has a hypolimnion composed primarily of anoxic water.

label: lake with a hypoxic hypolimnion
definition: A lake which has a hypolimnion composed primarily of hypoxic water.

label: hypoxic lake
definition: A lake which is primarily composed of hypoxic water.

label: oxic lake
definition: A lake which is primarily composed of oxic water.

label: lake with an oxic hypolimnion
definition: A lake which has a hypolimnion composed primarily of oxic water.

label: weather
definition: Environmental variability which inheres in an astronomical body part or in outer space.

label: atmospheric weather
definition: Weather which inheres in an atmosphere.

label: space weather
definition: Weather which inheres in outer space.

label: environmental variability
definition: A condition which inheres in an environmental system by virtue of that system undergoing variation in its composition, the distribution of the qualities its components bear, and/or in the processes which occur within it and which it participates in.

label: climate
definition: The disposition of an environmental system, particularly those influencing atmospheres, to manifest a cyclic pattern of weather over time.

label: cloud formation process
definition: A process during which water vapour condensing in the atmosphere aggregates into clouds.

label: particulate matter formation process
definition: A process during which microscopic solid or liquid objects are formed.

label: atmospheric aerosol formation
definition: An aerosol formation process which occurs in an atmosphere.

label: formation of a solid aerosol in an atmosphere
definition: A process during which an aerosol, consisting of solid particulates suspended in a gas, is formed in an atmosphere.

label: formation of a liquid aerosol in an atmosphere
definition: A process during which an aerosol, consisting of droplets of liquid suspended in gas, is formed in an atmosphere.

label: aerosolised liquids
definition: An aerosol which has non-gaseous parts that are primarily composed of liquid droplets.

label: aerosolised solids
definition: An aerosol which has non-gaseous parts that are primarily composed of solid particles.

label: formation of a solid aerosol from gaseous material in an atmosphere
definition: A process during which microscopic solid particulates are formed from gaseous materials in an atmosphere.

label: formation of a liquid aerosol from gaseous material in an atmosphere
definition: A process during which microscopic liquid droplets are formed from gaseous materials in an atmosphere.

label: tectonic lake
definition: A lake which is contained in a depression formed by the deformation and resulting lateral and vertical movements of a lithosphere.

label: tectonic movement
definition: A process during which pieces of a planetary crust and uppermost mantle move.

label: convergent tectonic movement
definition: A process during which pieces of a planetary crust and uppermost mantle move towards one another.

label: divergent tectonic movement
definition: A process during which pieces of a planetary crust and uppermost mantle move away from one another.

label: transform tectonic movement
definition: A process during which pieces of a planetary crust and uppermost mantle move along each other in a predominantly horizontal manner, either in a sinistral (left lateral) or dextral (right lateral) direction.

label: tectonic plate
definition: A part of a lithosphere which is separated by other such parts by geographic faults or similar geomorphological discontinuities.

label: tectonic plate boundary
definition: A geomorphological feature which is formed where two or more tectonic plates move towards, away from, or along one another, resulting in deformation of the lithosphere.

label: divergent plate boundary
definition: A geomorphological feature which is formed where two or more tectonic plates are actively moving away from one another, resulting in deformation of the lithosphere that forms rifts or ridges.

label: convergent plate boundary
definition: A geomorphological feature which is formed where two or more tectonic plates are actively moving towards one another, resulting in deformation of the lithosphere that forces one plate below the other where it melts in the mantle.

label: transform plate boundary
definition: A geomorphological feature which is formed where two or more tectonic plates are actively moving along one another in either a sinistral (left lateral) or dextral (right lateral) horizontal direction.

label: tectonic plate subduction
definition: A convergent tectonic movement process during which one plate moves under another and is forced or sinks due to gravity into a mantle.

label: detritus
definition: An organic material which is primarily composed of dead particulate matter.

label: rift zone
definition: A compound astronomical body part in which extensional tectonic processes occur and where the lithosphere is being pulled apart.

label: aeolian lake
definition: A lake which fills a basin that has been dammed by wind-blown sand,  formed between sand dunes oriented by winds; or formed by wind action under previously arid paleoenvironments.

label: landslide lake
definition: A lake which fills a depression where drainage is blocked by solid material transported by a landslide.

label: rockslide lake
definition: A lake which fills a depression where drainage is blocked by solid material transported by a rockslide.

label: rockslide process
definition: A rockslide is a process whereby a large mass of rock moves down a hill or a mountainside.

label: Karman vortex street
definition: A succession of swirling vortices caused by the unsteady separation of flow of a fluid around one or more blunt bodies.

label: ecosystem
definition: An environmental system which includes both living and non-living components.

label: fossil worm burrow
definition: A channel which was formed as a result of an annelid burrowing through soil, where organic residues lining the burrow have subsequently initiated fossilization.

label: fossilization of organic material
definition: A process during which organic substances are replaced with mineral substrances, maintaining part of their anatomical organisation.

label: forage material
definition: Material which is primarily conposed of the vegetation present in tended pastures: mainly grasses, with an interspersion of legumes and other forbs.

label: feed storage space
definition: A physical space, which may or may not be in a construction, which is used to store animal feed for agricultural purposes.

label: manure storage space
definition: A physical space, which may or may not be in a construction, which is used to store animal manure for agricultural purposes.

label: bovine dairy liquid manure
definition: Manure which has been collected directly or indirectly from dairy cattle, as from flushing of manure from concrete feed lanes, free stalls, and milking facilities.

label: poultry manure
definition: Manure which is composed primarily of the feces of poultry.

label: heat-treated animal manure
definition: Manure which has been subjected to heat treatment for solidification and/or sterilization purposes.

label: composted animal manure
definition: Manure which has been subjected to a natural process of 'rotting' or decomposition of its organic matter content by microorganisms under controlled conditions.

label: animal manure product
definition: A product which is composed primarily of animal manure that has been heat treated and packaged as a product for commercial or consumer use.

label: plant matter
definition: Organic material which is primarily composed of plant structures, living or dead.

label: gas planet
definition: A planet which is primarily composed of hydrogen and helium.

label: dwarf gas planet
definition: A gas planet which 1) is considerably smaller than a gas giant and 2) has a rocky core around which a thick envelope primarily composed of hydrogen, helium, and smaller proportions of volatiles.

label: giant gas planet
definition: A gas planet which has mass and size comparable to Jupiter and Saturn.

label: ice
definition: An ice is an environmental material which is either frozen or which is maintained in a solid state by gravitational forces or pressure.

label: astrogeological ice
definition: An astrogeological volatile which is composed primarily of chemical compounds with freezing points above an approximate threshold of 100 Kelvin.

label: ice giant
definition: A giant planet which is primarily composed of elements heavier than hydrogen and helium, volatile chemical compounds with freezing points above about 100 Kelvin.

label: mini-Neptune
definition: A gas planet which has an atmosphere composed of hydrogen and helium  - probably with deep layers of ice, rock or liquid oceans (made of water, ammonia, a mixture of both, or heavier volatiles) - and a small core made of low-density volatiles.

label: super-Jupiter
definition: An astronomical object which is more massive than the planet Jupiter.

label: gravitational motion
definition: A process during which one or more entities move along geodesics in a region of spacetime that has been sufficiently curved towards an entity with sufficient mass and/or energy.

label: hot Jupiter
definition: A giant gas planet which has a jovian-scale mass (0.3611.8 Jupiter masses), a short orbital period (1.3111 Earth days), and which is close to the star it orbits, resulting in extreme and exotic atmospheric properties.

label: hot Neptune
definition: A gas planet which has a mass similar to that of Neptune or Uranus and which closely orbits its star (normally at a distance less than 1 Astronomical Unit).

label: mega-Earth
definition: A terrestrial exoplanet which is at least ten times the mass of Earth.

label: super-Earth
definition: A terrestrial planet which has a mass higher than Earth's, but substantially below the masses of Uranus and Neptune (15 and 17 Earth masses, respectively).

label: desert planet
definition: A terrestrial planet which has a surface dominated by hot deserts.

label: ocean planet
definition: A planet which has a surface layer that nearly completely or completely covered by water, and which has a substantial portion of its mass composed of water.

label: ice planet
definition: A planet which has a surface layer that nearly completely or completely covered by ice, and which has a substantial portion of its mass composed of ice.

label: carbon dioxide ice
definition: Ice which is primarily composed of carbon dioxide.

label: methane ice
definition: Ice which is primarily composed of methane.

label: ammonia ice
definition: Ice which is primarily composed of ammonia.

label: carbon monoxide ice
definition: Ice which is primarily composed of carbon monoxide.

label: iron planet
definition: A planet which in primarily composed of an iron-rich core with little to no mantle

label: lava planet
definition: A planet which has a surface layer that nearly completely or completely covered by lava, and which has a substantial portion of its mass composed of lava.

label: sub-Earth
definition: A terrestrial planet which has a mass smaller than Earth's, such that 1) it lacks a magnetic field strong enough to shield its atmosphere from erosion by stellar wind and 2) it has comparatively short periods of geological activity unless it is subject to gravitational tidal forces from a much more massive object.

label: chthonian planet
definition: A planet which is formed as a result of a gas giant's hydrogen and helium atmosphere, as well as its outer layers, being stripped away by a stellar wind through photoevaporation and hydrodynamic escape.

label: photoevaporation
definition: A process during which energetic radiation ionises gas and causes it to disperse away from the ionising source.

label: helium planet
definition: A gas planet which has an atmosphere composed primarily of helium.

label: planetesimal
definition: An astronomical body which 1) is held together by its own gravity, 2)  can attract other, similar bodies through mutual gravitational influence, and 3) has orbital dynamics that are not significantly affected by gas drag.

label: protoplanet
definition: An astronomical object that forms within a protoplanetary disc when planetesimals and other solid debris aggregate and, due to gravitational forces,  fuse and initiate internal melting to produce a differentiated interior.

label: protoplanetary disk
definition: An astronomical object which is composed of dense gas and dust rotating around a young newly formed star, a T Tauri star, or a Herbig Ae/Be star in a disk-shaped configuration.

label: proplyd
definition: A protoplanetary disk which is externally illuminated and undergoing photoevaporation.

label: mesoplanet
definition: A planet which is smaller than Mercury but larger than Ceres.

label: circumbinary planet
definition: A planet which orbits two stars.

label: volatile astrogeological material
definition: A material which is composed primarily of chemical elements and compounds with relatively low boiling points, equilibrium condensation temperatures below 1300 Kelvin, and which are part of the crust or atmosphere of a moon or planet.

label: astrogeological gas
definition: An astrogeological volatile which is composed primarily of chemical compounds with boiling points around those of hydrogen and helium.

label: refractory astrogeological material
definition: A material which is composed primarily of chemical elements and compounds which have equilibrium condensation temperatures above approximately 1300 Kelvin and which are part of the crust or atmosphere of a moon or planet.

label: atmospheric escape
definition: A process during which gases that constitute a planetary atmosphere escape that planet's gravitational field and move away into outer space.

label: hydrodynamic escape
definition: An atmospheric escape process during which atoms that are parts of a planetary atmosphere escape into outer space through numerous collisions with lighter atoms in that atmosphere.

label: cirrus homogenitus cloud
definition: A cloud which is cirriform and is formed by condensation events centred on an aircraft's contrail.

label: cirrus cloud
definition: A cloud which is fibrous and/or has a silky sheen, often present in aggregates where individual cirrus clouds are organised in patches or narrow bands of white or mostly white detached filmanents.

label: obsolete newCloud
definition: OBSOLETE A cloud which

label: IUCN strict nature reserve
definition: An IUCN protected area in which human visitation, use and impacts are strictly controlled and limited to ensure protection and conservation of natural biodiversity and/or geodiversity, natural ecosystem assemblages and processes, and any associated cultural and spiritual values.

label: IUCN wilderness area
definition: An IUCN protected area which 1) is dominated by natural ecosystems, 2) is sufficiently large to allow those ecosystems to function and develop without local anthropogenic perturbation, 3) is  managed to prevent perturbations by proximate or local anthropisation, including those caused by local and/or indigenous human communities or human visitation.

label: geodiversity
definition: A quality which inheres in a astronomical body or astronomical body part by virtue of the variation in its material composition, participation in geological processes, and the variation in is land- and hydroforms.

label: IUCN natural monument or feature
definition: An IUCN protected area which includes a primarily natural formation designated to be of high natural heritage value and the environmental systems which it determines (e.g. the spray zone of a waterfall monument).

label: IUCN habitat/species management area
definition: An IUCN protected area within which the habitats of or ecosystems used by floral and faunal species deemed to be of international, national, or local importance are maintained, conserved, or restored such that their composition and functional integrity are maintained.

label: ecosystem fragment
definition: An ecosystem which has been causally isolated from a larger ecosystem within which it was previously embedded, such that the direct exchange of materials, resources, and energy between these systems is severely or entirely curtailed.

label: ecosystem fragmentation process
definition: A process during which one or more parts of an ecosystem become causally isolated such that the direct flow or exchange of materials, resources, and energy between a given fragment and the remainder of the original system is severely curtailed or entirely halted.

label: area protected according to IUCN guidelines
definition: A protected area in which management objectives have been declared, by a local governing body or authority, to adhere to the guidelines set forth by the International Union for the Conservation of Nature (IUCN).

label: active ecosystem management process
definition: A process during which an ecosystem, its parts, or the processes it participates in are modified by human intervention to accomplish an objective.

label: conservation-focused active ecosystem management process
definition: An active management process which has the conservation of an ecosystem, or a part thereof, as its primary objective.

label: IUCN protected landscape/seascape
definition: An IUCN protected area which 1) includes entities that have been deemed to be of high scenic quality, 2) is composed of a historically stable assemblage of causally interlinked natural and anthropised ecosystems that provides cultural ecosystem services, and 3) hosts traditional and sustainable human activities.

label: sacred site
definition: A site which is bounded or relativised by a material entity which is of spiritual significance to one or more human groups.

label: ecosystem decay
definition: A process during which an ecosystem fragment loses its system integrity, with many of its resident ecological populations 1) losing their habitats, 2) undergoing a loss of functional and phylogenetic diversity, and 3) undergoing a subsequent genetic destabilisation through inbreeding.

label: habitat fragmentation process
definition: An ecosystem fragmentation process during which discontinuities emerge in the habitats of one or more ecological populations.

label: environment associated with an aquatic invertebrate
definition: An environment which has its properties and composition largely determined by the presence of a metazoan which lacks a vetebral column and which has a habitat that is found in an aquatic environmental system.

label: arable land
definition: Land which is regularly manipulated by human activities, such as plowing or tilling, in order to grow crops.

label: pasturable land
definition: Land which hosts a community of herbaceous plants - such as grasses and forbs - upon which animals may graze.

label: cnidarian-associated environment
definition: An environmental system determined by a cnidarian or part of a cnidarian.

label: Bondon cheese environment
definition: An environment which has its properties and composition determined by a portion of Bondon cheese.

label: rhizoplane
definition: A surface layer which is composed of the external surface of a root, together with closely adhering soil particles and debris

label: tended pasturable land
definition: Pasturable land which is maintained by human activities in order to provide grazing oppoturnities for livestock.

label: arable or pasturable land
definition: Land which either hosts plant communities upon which animals may graze has been manipulated by tilling, ploughing, or other human activity for the purposes of seed sowing or planting crops.

label: arable
definition: A quality inhereing in a bearer by virtue of the bearer being periodically and mechanically manipulated to loosen and mix any soil which it has as a part.

label: acidic soil
definition: Soil which has increased levels of molecules or ions capable of donating a hydron (proton or hydrogen ion) to other chemical entities, or, alternatively, capable of forming covalent bonds with other chemicals via the acceptance of an electron pair, resulting in a bulk pH measurement of less than 7.

label: acidic volcanic ash
definition: Volcanic ash which has increased levels of molecules or ions capable of donating a hydron (proton or hydrogen ion) to other chemical entities, or, alternatively, capable of forming covalent bonds with other chemicals via the acceptance of an electron pair, resulting in a bulk pH measurement of less than 7.

label: holothurian digestive tract
definition: A digestive tract environment which has its properties and dynamics determined by the digestive tract of an echinoderm from the class Holothuroidea.

label: holothurian digestive tract contents
definition: A bodily fluid which is present in the digestive tract of a member of the Holothuroidea.

label: brown sea ice
definition: Sea ice which has a brown colouration, either due to 1) the presence of pigments which are or were contained in the members of ecological assemblages, such as algal communities, living or trapped within the ice or 2) due to the presence of trapped sediments.

label: water surface
definition: The surface layer of a volume of water.

label: sediment surface
definition: The surface layer of a mass of sediment.

label: magnetosphere
definition: A site in which charged particles are influenced by an astronomical body's magnetic field.

label: radiation shielding disposition
definition: An environmental disposition which inheres in an entity that intercepts, attenuates, or blocks radiation.

label: cosmic ray shielding disposition
definition: A radiation shielding disposition which inheres in a material or immaterial entity which attenuates or blocks cosmic rays.

label: induced magnetosphere
definition: A magnetosphere which either 1) cannot withstand the pressure of the stellar wind interacting with it, thus allowing the stellar wind to interact with the ionosphere, atmosphere, or surface of the planet generating it or 2) is formed by the interaction of the stellar wind with an astronomical body unshielded by its own magnetosphere.

label: intrinsic magnetosphere
definition: A magnetosphere which shields the body generating it from the stellar wind by withstanding the stellar wind's pressure before it reaches the body.

label: terrestrial environmental zone
definition: An environmental zone which is bounded by material parts of a land mass or the atmosphere or space adjacent to it.

label: anthropised terrestrial environmental zone
definition: A terrestrial zone which is bounded by constructed, manufactured, or other anthropogenic material entities.

label: marine environmental zone
definition: An environmental zone which is bounded by material parts of a marine environment.

label: alluvium
definition: Soil or sediment which has been eroded and influenced by flowing water and redeposited in a non-marine setting.

label: alluvial sediment
definition: Sediment which has been transported by flowing water and redeposited in a non-marine setting.

label: alluvial deposit
definition: A rock which is formed as a result of the lithification of alluvium.

label: lithification
definition: A process during which sediments compact under pressure, expel connate fluids, and gradually become solid sedimentary rock.

label: grassland ecosystem
definition: An ecosystem in which grasses (Graminae) are the dominant form of vegetation and determine the system's structure and dynamics.

label: ranch
definition: An area of land used for the herding and grazing of livestock.

label: swamp area
definition: An area of wetland which overlaps a swamp ecosystem.

label: wetland ecosystem
definition: A terrestrial ecosystem which is inundated or saturated by surface or ground water at a frequency and duration sufficient to support, and that under normal circumstances does support, a prevalence of vegetation typically adapted for life in saturated soil conditions.

label: defence against flooding
definition: A planned process during which an environmental system is modified to mitigate or nullify the impacts of flooding.

label: stellar radiation|stellar radiation
definition: An electromagnetic radiation process during which electromagnetic waves or their quanta are emitted from a star.

label: microwave stellar radiation|microwave stellar radiation
definition: A stellar radiation process during which electromagnetic waves or their quanta are emitted from a star at wavelengths and frequencies which travel exclusively in a line-of-sight fashion and which may produce molecular rotation and torsion on contact with matter.

label: radio wave stellar radiation|radio wave stellar radiation
definition: A stellar radiation process during which electromagnetic waves or their quanta are emitted from a star at wavelengths ranging from millimetre to kilometer scales.

label: infrared stellar radiation|infrared stellar radiation
definition: A stellar radiation process during which electromagnetic waves or their quanta are emitted from a star when molecules change their rotational-vibrational movements, usually at wavelengths between 760 nm and 1 mm.

label: visible spectrum stellar radiation|visible spectrum stellar radiation
definition: A stellar radiation process during which electromagnetic waves or their quanta are emitted from a star at wavelengths between 380 nm and 760 nm.

label: ultraviolet stellar radiation|ultraviolet stellar radiation
definition: A stellar radiation process during which electromagnetic waves or their quanta are emitted from a star at wavelengths between 10 nm and 400 nm.

label: X-ray stellar radiation|X-ray stellar radiation
definition: A stellar radiation process during which penetrating electromagnetic radiation is emitted by high-energy electrons as they fall into a lower state of energy.

label: gamma-ray stellar radiation|gamma-ray stellar radiation
definition: A stellar radiation process during which penetrating electromagnetic radiation is emitted from the radioactive decay (gamma decay) of atomic nuclei.

label: ionizing stellar radiation|ionizing stellar radiation
definition: A stellar radiation process during which electromagnetic waves or their quanta are emitted from a star with sufficient energy to disrupt molecular bonds or alter the electron number of atoms.

label: water accumulation process
definition: A process during which liquid water accumulates in a site, most often in some form of container.

label: office building
definition: A commercial building which contains parts used as workplaces primarily for administrative and managerial workers.

label: commercial building
definition: A building which is primarily used to facilitate the buying or selling of goods or services.

label: lumber production process
definition: A process during which wood is processed into beams or planks.

label: office
definition: A building part within which administrative work is done by an organisations users in order to support and realise the objectives of that organization.

label: IUCN protected area with sustainable use of natural resources
definition: An IUCN protected area within which 1) natural ecosystems and their resources are either conserved or used through non-industrial human activities, 2) usage activites contribute to conservation goals, ensuring inter-generational security for local communities' livelihoods, and 3) the majority of benefits derived from the use of ecosystems are received by communities living near or in the area.

label: terrestrial natural environment
definition: A natural environment which is located on a land mass.

label: aquatic natural environment
definition: A natural environment which is within a water body.

label: Hill sphere
definition: A site in which the attraction of satellites by gravitation is dominated by an astronomical body, bounded by a zero-velocity surface.

label: Lagrangian point
definition: A site in which the combined gravitational pull of the two large astronomical bodies is such that a smaller body, affected only by gravity, can maintain a stable position relative to those two large bodies and orbit with them due to centripetal force.

label: tropical marginal sea biome
definition: A marginal sea biome which is located in a region with a tropical climate.

label: kerogen
definition: Organic material which is in a solid phase and contained in sedimentary rock.

label: sapropelic kerogen
definition: Kerogen which cotains alginite, amorphous organic matter, cyanobacteria, freshwater algae, and land plant resins, thus having a hydrogen to carbon ratio above 1.25, and oxygen to carbon ratio below 0.15, readily produces liquid hydrocarbons, has reduced concentrations of aromatic structures, and primarily derived from proteins and lipids.

label: labile kerogen
definition: Kerogen from which heavy hydrocarbons (such as oils) are derived following chemical break down.

label: recalcitrant kerogen
definition: Kerogen from which light hydrocarbons (such as hydrocarbon gases) are derived following chemical break down.

label: planktonic kerogen
definition: Kerogen which is enriched in sulfur compounds, has a hydrogen to carbon ratio under 1.25, an oxygen to carbon ratio between 0.03 and 0.18, derives into mixtures of hydrocarbon gas and oil, and derives from marine organic materials (primarily lipids) which are formed in reducing environments.

label: sulfrous kerogen
definition: Planktonic kerogen which has high concentrations of sulfur compounds.

label: humic kerogen
definition: Kerogen which derives from land plants, resembles wood or coral in structure, has a hydrogen to carbon ratio under 1, an oxygen to carbon ratio between 0.03 to 0.3, and which primarily produces coal or hydrocarbon gas on degradation.

label: residual kerogen
definition: Kerogen which has a hydrogen to carbon ratio less than  0.5 and primarily composed of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons.

label: woodland canopy
definition: A canopy which is part of a woodland ecosystem.

label: crop canopy
definition: A canopy which is composed of the aboveground portion, or crowns, of a community of crop plants.

label: canopy
definition: A vegetation layer which is formed by a collection of individual plant crowns, themselves constituting part of the aboveground portion of a plant community.

label: forest ecosystem
definition: An ecosystem which is determined by communities of plants with a tree growth form and in which members of those communities form continuous or discontinuous regions of canopy cover.

label: cropland ecosystem
definition: An ecosystem which 1) is determined by communities of annual crops, perennial woody crops, or by actively tilled land, 2) is primarily used for agricultural activity, and 3) contains no village or larger human settlement.

label: woodland ecosystem
definition: An ecosystem which is determined by communities of plants with a tree growth form and in which members of those communities are spaced sufficiently far apart to allow sunlight to illuminate the understory.

label: agricultural process
definition: A process during which humans rear animals or plants on land for harvest and consumption.

label: agronomic process
definition: An agricultural process during which humans rear plants on land for harvest and consumption.

label: animal husbandry
definition: An agricultural process during which humans rear animals on land for harvest and consumption.

label: crustacean farming process
definition: An aquaculture process during which humans rear crustaceans.

label: finfish farming process
definition: An aquaculture process during which humans rear finfish.

label: mollusc farming process
definition: An aquaculture process during which humans rear molluscs.

label: seaweed farming process
definition: An aquaculture process during which humans rear seaweed.

label: freshwater macrophyte farming process
definition: An aquaculture process during which humans rear freshwater macrophytes.

label: animal aquaculture process
definition: An aquaculture process during which humans rear animals.

label: plant aquaculture process
definition: An aquaculture process during which humans rear plants.

label: coastal shrimp pond
definition: A shrimp pond which is embedded in a coastal water body.

label: saline shrimp pond water
definition: Saline water which is derived from sea water and used during the cultivation of crustaceans.

label: vog
definition: A fog which is composed of liquid aerosols and gases derived from volcanic gas emissions (primarily sulfur oxides), formed when sulfur-bearing gases react with sunlight, oxygen, and moisture in an atmosphere.

label: transport of waste to a designated storage site
definition: A process during which materials deemed to be waste are removed from a site and transported to another site designated for its storage.

label: waste disposal process
definition: A process during which materials deemed to be waste are transported away from a site.

label: transport of child feces to a designated site
definition: A waste disposal process during which the feces of human children is transported to a designated storage site.

label: transport of household waste to a designated storage site
definition: A process during which materials used in a household and deemed to be waste are removed from the housing unit and transported to another site designated for its storage.

label: area designated for human defecation
definition: A site which has been designated as a place where humans may defecate.

label: area designated for waste storage
definition: A site which has been designated for the storage of waste material.

label: thermal pollution
definition: An environmental pollution process during which the temperature of an environmental system, or parts thereof, is raised above its natural levels.

label: thermal pollution of an aquatic system
definition: A thermal pollution process which occurs in a water body or aquatic environment.

label: stormwater
definition: Water which accumulates on a solid surface during precipitation events and snow/ice melt.

label: urban stormwater
definition: Stormwater which accumulates in an urban ecosystem.

label: area of developed space
definition: An area of a planet's surface which is primarily covered by constructed or manufactured objects and materials, possibly interspersed with cultivated or anthropically maintained vegetation.

label: rural stormwater
definition: Stormwater which accumulates in a rural ecosystem.

label: impermeable surface layer
definition: A surface layer through which liquids or gases cannot pass.

label: constructed pavement
definition: A construction which comprises a durable surface layer overlying a solid surface intended to sustain vehicular or foot traffic.

label: liquid layer
definition: A layer which is primarily composed of some liquid material.

label: material isosurface
definition: A layer throughout which one or more qualities (e.g. pressure, temperature, velocity, density) maintain an approximately constant value.

label: solid layer
definition: A layer which is primarily composed of some solid material, allowing for non-solid parts such as interstitial pockets of gas or liquid.

label: water ice layer
definition: A solid layer which is primarily composed of some water-based ice.

label: asphalt road
definition: A road which is primarily composed of asphalt.

label: concrete road
definition: A road which is primarily composed of concrete.

label: sidewalk
definition: A constructed pavement which is built on the side of a road and intended for foot traffic.

label: driveway
definition: A road which is used for local access to one or more structures, and is privately owned and maintained by an individual or group.

label: paved parking lot
definition: A constructed pavement which is used for parking vehicles.

label: silica dust
definition: Dust which is composed primarily of slicon dioxide.

label: aluminium dust
definition: Dust which is primarily composed of aluminium particles.

label: barium dust
definition: Dust which is primarily composed of barium particles.

label: talc dust
definition: Dust which is primarily composed of hydrated magnesium silicate (talc) particles.

label: slate dust
definition: Dust which is primarily composed of slate particles.

label: industrial fire
definition: A fire which occurs in an industrial area or building.

label: kaolin dust
definition: Dust which is primarily composed of kaolinite particles.

label: brush fire
definition: A land fire which consumes low-growing plants such as scrub and brush.

label: bush fire
definition: A land fire which occurs in a large uncleared or sparsely settled area (as in Australia) usually scrub-covered or forested.

label: pasture fire
definition: A fire which occurs in a pastureland.

label: land fire
definition: A fire which occurs on land, typically consuming a terrestrial ecosystem as fuel.

label: bush area
definition: A vegetated area which has not been cleared or is sparsely settled, usually scrub-covered or forested

label: convective storm
definition: An atmospheric storm which is generated by the heating and convection of moist and unstable air masses.

label: extra-tropical cyclone
definition: A warm-core cyclone which occurs in the middle and high latitudes, primarily drawing energy from horizontal temperature contrasts between atmospheric fronts.

label: tropical storm
definition: A an atmospheric storm which originates over tropical or subtropical waters and possesses a warm-core, non-frontal synoptic-scale cyclone with a low pressure centre, spiral rain bands and strong winds.

label: cyclone
definition: An atmospheric storm during which a large mass of atmospheric gas rotates around a centre of low atmospheric pressure, generating high winds which spiral towards that centre.

label: warm core cyclone
definition: A cyclone which rotates around an area low atmospheric pressure with increased temperature.

label: atmospheric zone
definition: An environmental zone which is part of an atmosphere.

label: area of low atmospheric pressure
definition: An atmospheric zone in which atmospheric gaseous masses have reduced atmospheric pressure.

label: aquatic estuarine layer
definition: A layer of liquid that is part of an estuary.

label: estuarine coastal surface layer
definition: A layer of estuarine water which extends a few centimeters from the surface of the water column towards the estuary bed and from the shore to a fiat boundary where the estuary bed below the water column reaches a depth of 4 meters.

label: environmental role
definition: A role which is may be realised by an environmental system

label: oasis
definition: An oasis is a vegetated area located in a desert, supplied with water from a water source which it surrounds, and surrounded by arid soil, sand, or rock.

label: vegetated area
definition: A vegetated area is a geographic feature which has ground cover dominated by plant communities.

label: bone element environment
definition: An environment which is determined by a bone element.

label: hydroform
definition: A geographic feature which is primarily composed of a continuous volume of liquid water held in shape or sustained by an environmental process.

label: liquid air-water interface layer
definition: A liquid surface layer which is in contact with air.

label: liquid surface layer
definition: A surface layer which is composed primarily of some liquid.

label: solid surface layer
definition: A surface layer which is composed primarily of solid environmental material.

label: estuarine coastal upper water column
definition: A layer of estuarine water which extends from the surface of the water column to the pycnocline or mid-depth and from the shore to a fiat boundary where the estuary bed below the water column reaches a depth of 4 meters.

label: estuarine coastal pycnocline
definition: A pycnocline which is part of an estuarine water body, spanning from the shore to a fiat boundary where the estuary bed below the water column reaches a depth of 4 meters.

label: estuarine coastal lower water column
definition: A layer of estuarine water which extends from an estuarine pycnocline or mid-depth to the estuarine bed and from the shore to a fiat boundary where the estuary bed below the water column reaches a depth of 4 meters.

label: estuarine open water surface layer
definition: A layer of estuarine water which extends a few centimeters from the surface of the water column towards the estuary bed and from a fiat boundary where the estuary bed below the water column reaches a depth of 4 meters until the end of the estuary most distal from the coast.

label: estuarine open water upper water column
definition: A layer of estuarine water which extends from the surface of the water column to the pycnocline or mid-depth and from a fiat boundary where the estuary bed below the water column reaches a depth of 4 meters until the end of the estuary most distal from the coast.

label: estuarine tidal riverine coastal surface layer
definition: A layer of fresh estuarine water which extends a few centimeters from the surface of the water column towards the estuary bed and from the land-water interface to a fiat boundary where the estuary bed below the water column reaches a depth of 4 meters.

label: estuarine tidal riverine coastal upper water column
definition: A layer of fresh estuarine water which extends from the surface of the water column to the pycnocline or mid-depth and from the land-water interface to a fiat boundary where the estuary bed below the water column reaches a depth of 4 meters.

label: saline water body
definition: A body of water which is primarily composed of saline water.

label: fresh water body
definition: A body of water which is primarily composed of freshwater, with low solute content.

label: brackish water body
definition: A body of water which is primarily composed of brackish water.

label: estuarine open water lower water column
definition: A layer of estuarine water which extends from an estuarine pycnocline or mid-depth to the estuary bed and from a fiat boundary where the estuary bed below the water column reaches a depth of 4 meters to end of the estuary most distal from the coast.

label: estuarine open water pycnocline
definition: A pycnocline which is part of an estuarine water body, spanning from a fiat boundary where the estuary bed below the water column reaches a depth of 4 meters until the end of the estuary most distal from the coast.

label: estuarine tidal riverine coastal pycnocline
definition: An estuarine coastal pycnocline which is composed primarily of fresh tidal water.

label: estuarine tidal riverine coastal lower water column
definition: A layer of fresh estuarine water which extends from an estuarine pycnocline or mid-depth to the estuarine bed and from the land-water interface to a fiat boundary where the estuary bed below the water column reaches a depth of 4 meters.

label: estuarine tidal riverine open water surface layer
definition: A layer of fresh, tidal estuarine water which extends a few centimeters from the surface of the water column towards the estuary bed and from a fiat boundary where the estuary bed below the water column reaches a depth of 4 meters until the end of the estuary most distal from the coast.

label: estuarine tidal riverine open water upper water column
definition: A layer of fresh, tidal estuarine water which extends from the surface of the water column to the pycnocline or mid-depth and from a fiat boundary where the estuary bed below the water column reaches a depth of 4 meters until the end of the estuary most distal from the coast.

label: estuarine tidal riverine open water pycnocline
definition: An estuarine open water pycnocline which is composed primarily of fresh tidal water.

label: estuarine tidal riverine open water lower water column
definition: A layer of fresh estuarine water which extends from an estuarine pycnocline or mid-depth to the estuary bed and from a fiat boundary where the estuary bed below the water column reaches a depth of 4 meters to end of the estuary most distal from the coast.

label: nitrogen cycling
definition: A biogeochemical cycle which has nitrogen-bearing chemical entities as participants.

label: sulfur cycling
definition: A biogeochemical cycle which has sulfur-bearing chemical entities as participants.

label: phosphorous cycling
definition: A biogeochemical cycle which has phosphorous-bearing chemical entities as participants.

label: marine tidal flow process
definition: A tidal flow process which occurs in an ocean or sea and during which tidal movements generate advective flows, often amplified in velocity when moving through an inlet, pass or channel.

label: advective transport process
definition: A material transport process during which a volume of material is displaced due to a disequilibrium in physical forces and during which 1) the qualities that inhere in that volume and 2) the processes that are unfolding within it are largely unchanged.

label: anchor ice
definition: An ice mass which is attached to a bed underneath a body of water.

label: marine tidal flow
definition: A marine current which is maintained by a tidal flow process.

label: riverine anchor ice
definition: Anchor ice which is attached to a riverbed.

label: diurnal marine tidal flow zone
definition: A marine zone in which ocean waters undergo a diurnal (once per day) tidal oscillation - with one high and one low tide per day - due to the supression of a second daily oscillation by the geometry of the ocean basin and obstructions presented by land masses.

label: diurnal marine tidal flow process
definition: A tidal flow process which occurs once per day in ocean waters where a second daily oscillation is blocked by land masses or ocean basin geometry.

label: semi-diurnal marine tidal flow zone
definition: A marine tidal flow zone in which ocean waters undergo a semi-diurnal (twice per day) tidal oscillation - with two high and two low tides per day of roughly equal amplitude.

label: marine tidal flow zone
definition: An environmental zone in which varying gravitational forces from astronomical bodies, combined with the rotation of the astronomical body containing the zone, cause marine waters to undergo periodic depth oscillations (tides).

label: tidal flow process
definition: A water flow process during which movements of water masses caused by varying gravitational and rotational forces from astronomical bodies, combined with the rotation of the astronomical body containing the water mass, cause waters to undergo periodic depth oscillations (tides).

label: semi-diurnal marine tidal flow process
definition: A marine tidal flow process which occurs twice per day, resulting in two high and two low tides per day, both of roughly equal amplitude.

label: freshwater seep riverine anchor ice
definition: Anchor ice which is attached to a riverbed where a river flows into a marine water body and which is formed by the freezing of freshwater seeping out of the riverbed's sediments.

label: floating ice mass
definition: An ice mass which is suspended in a water body, being sufficiently buoyant for part of the mass to breach the surface of that water body.

label: erosion
definition: An action of exogenic processes (such as water flow or wind) which remove environmental material from one location on the surface of an astronomical body, transporting it to another location where it is deposited.

label: glacial equlibrium line
definition: A zone on a glacier which is roughly linear and where the rates of ice ablation and accumulation are approximately equal.

label: material accumulation zone
definition: A zone in which the deposition and accumulation of an environmental material occurs.

label: material decumulation zone
definition: A zone in which processes resulting in the removal of one or more environmental materials have higher rates than pocesses which result in their deposition and accumulation.

label: ice accumulation zone
definition: A material accumulation zone in which the rates of ice formation processes exceed those of ice decumulation processes, leading to a net icrease in some mass of ice.

label: ice decumulation zone
definition: A material decumulation zone in which the rates of ice formation processes are below those of ice decumulation processes, leading to a net decrease in some mass of ice.

label: glacial ice accumulation zone
definition: An ice accumulation zone which overlaps part of a glacier.

label: environmental zone of processual equilibrium
definition: An environmental zone in which the rates of two or more processes are roughly equal to one another.

label: volcanic crater glacier
definition: A glacier which is contained in the site bounded by a volcanic crater.

label: crater zone
definition: The site which is located in a crater.

label: volcanic crater zone
definition: The site which is located in a volcanic crater.

label: desert
definition: A landform which has been rendered barren or partially barren by environmental extremes, especially by low rainfall.

label: hydroclimate
definition: A climate which is realised through hydrological processes.

label: atmospheric aerosolised particle formation event
definition: An aerosol formation event  which occurs in an atmosphere.

label: Paramo
definition: An alpine tundra ecosystem which exists above the continuous timberline but below the permanent snowline on elevated land in tropical regions.

label: atmospheric wind direction
definition: A direction which inheres in an atmospheric wind, typically expressed as the inverse of the direction the wind is moving in.

label: atmospheric wind speed
definition: The speed of an atmospheric wind.

label: volume of hydrological precipitation
definition: The volume of water which has fallen during a precipitation process.

label: climate system
definition: A system which consists of an atmosphere, hydrosphere, cryosphere, land surface, and  biosphere, forced or influenced by external processes.

label: atmospheric secondary aerosol formation process
definition: A process during which gas-phase molecules form solid or liquid particles that are stable enough to continue growing in size - via the condensation or aggregation of other gas-phase molecules - at a greater rate than their constituents re-enter gas phase.

label: aerosolised particle formation process
definition: A process during which particles suspended in a gaseous medium are formed.

label: primary aerosol formation process
definition: A material transport process during which solid or liquid particles are directly introduced into a volume of gas.

label: secondary aerosol formation process
definition: An aerosol formation process during which solid or liquid particles are either 1) formed in a volume of gas through gas-to-liquid or gas-to-solid conversions or 2) increase in size through aggregation with other particles.

label: tidal mangrove shrubland
definition: A shrubland biome which is densely vegetated by dwarf or short mangroves (and associates) that are generally less than 6 meters in height, is tidally influenced,  is located in tropical or subtropical areas.

label: tundra ecosystem
definition: An ecosystem which 1) typically has monthly average temperatures below 10 degrees Celsius 2) has a low evapotranspiration ratio 3) is dominated by treeless terrain, covered by communities of low-growing vegetation such as dwarf shrubs, sedges and grasses, mosses, and lichens, 4) contains areas of soil underlain by permafrost with a thin active layer and 5) occurs in both polar and alpine regions (i.e., both high latitudes and high altitudes), and 5) does not have permanent snow or ice cover.

label: alpine tundra ecosystem
definition: A tundra ecosystem which exists at high altitudes and where vegetation is stunted due to low temperatures and high winds.

label: aerosolised particle formation event
definition: An aerosol formation process during which the rate of particle formation exceeds that which is normally present in the site of its occurrence.

label: secondary atmospheric aerosol formation event
definition: A secondary aerosol formation process which occurs in an atmosphere at an increased rate relative to background processes of the same kind.

label: sea state
definition: A physical quality which inheres in a marine water body by virtue of the height, wavelength, period, and directional energy flux of its waves which evolve into swell through nonlinear dynamics.

label: sea ice variability
definition: A variability quality which inheres in sea ice, particularly in its concentration, area and extent, type, motion, deformation, age, thickness, and volume.

label: marine faunal bed
definition: A marine bed which is covered by animals which have benthic habitats, including attached, clinging, sessile, infaunal, burrowing, laying, interstitial, and slow-moving animals, but not animals that have created substrate.

label: sea surface height
definition: A elevation quality which inheres in a marine water body by virtue of the position of that water body's surface layer (adjacent to an atmosphere) relative to some reference elevation.

label: marine bed
definition: A bed which underlies a marine water body.

label: mussel bed
definition: A marine faunal bed which is dominated by mussels of the Mytilus or Modiolus genera either 1) resting on the sediment surface, 2)  partially embedded in the sediment, 3) attached to conspecifics (by using their byssal threads), or 4) attached to a piece of gravel in slightly gravelly fine sediments.

label: neritic mussel reef
definition: A marine reef which is located on a shelf (i.e. in the neritic zone) and primarily composed of self-adhered or conglomerated mussel shells.

label: oceanic mussel reef
definition: A marine reef which is present in the depths beyond (offshore relative to) the continental shelf and primarily composed of self-adhered or conglomerated mussel shells.

label: area of attached mussel assemblages
definition: An area which is dominated by dense accumulations of mussels attached to a substrate other than conspecifics, including the associated faunal communities and predators present on the mussels (e.g., starfish).

label: area of attached Modiolus assemblages
definition: An area which is dominated by dense accumulations of mussels, of the genus Modiolus, attached to a substrate other than conspecifics, including the associated faunal communities and predators present on the mussels (e.g., starfish).

label: area of attached faunal communities
definition: An environmental zone within which ecological communities of  animals are attached to some substrate.

label: Bathymodiolus-dominated oceanic mussel reef
definition: An oceanic mussel reef which is primarily settled by mussels of the genus Bathymodiolus and primarily composed of self-adhered or conglomerated mussel shells

label: mussel reef
definition: A marine reef which is primarily composed of self-adhered or conglomerated mussel shells.

label: obsolete Bathymodiolus-dominated oceanic mussel bed
definition: An oceanic mussel reef which is primarily settled by mussels of the genus Bathymodiolus and primarily composed of self-adhered or conglomerated mussel shells

label: oceanic mussel bed
definition: A mussel bed which is located in benthic regions beyond (offshore to) a continental shelf.

label: neritic mussel bed
definition: A mussel bed which is located in benthic regions that are part of a continental shelf.

label: Bathymodiolus-dominated oceanic mussel bed
definition: An oceanic mussel bed which has mussel communities dominated by members of the genus Bathymodiolus.

label: accumulation of matter on aerosolised particles
necromass
definition: Biomass which is composed primarily of dead organisms, their parts, or their organic derivatives.

label: abyssal clay
definition: Clay which is part of an abyssal plain.

label: ultisol
definition: A soil which has high mineral content and which contain no calcareous material, have less than 10% weatherable minerals its surface layer, and have less than 35% base saturation throughout its volume.

label: aerosolisation of dust
definition: A primary aerosol formation process during which dust particles are suspended in a gaseous medium.

label: atmospheric aerosolisation of dust
definition: A process during which dust is aerosolised in an atmosphere.

label: homomutatus cloud
definition: An aeroform which is formed as a result of strong upper winds spreading a cirrus homogenitus cloud in the atmosphere and, in turn, causing internal tranformations which result in the cloud taking on the appearnce of natural cirri-form clouds.

label: haze formation process
definition: An environmental process during which a haze is formed by the aerosolisation of solid particles, including natural materials and anthropogenic pollutants, in an atmosphere.

label: haze
definition: An aersolised mass of dust, smoke, or other dry particulates which scatters visible light thus obsscuring visibility through an atmosphere.

label: haze formation event
definition: A haze formation process which has an increased rate relative to that which is usually present in a given site.

label: ecological province
definition: An ecosystem which is of larger scale than an ecoregion and which includes smaller ecosystems determined by the presence of ecological assemblages that have at least some cohesion over evolutionary time frames.

label: laboratory environment
definition: An anthropogenic environment which is bounded by the building envelope of a laboratory and in which a system of manufactured products exert control on one or more of its environmental conditions.

label: laboratory facility
definition: A research facility in which systems of manufactured products control internal conditions and in which scientific or technological research, experiments, and measurement may be performed.

label: cirrocumulus cloud
definition: A cloud which is organised as a thin, white patch, sheet or layer without shading and is composed of very small, regularly arranged, merged or separated structural elements such as grains and ripples.

label: cirrostratus cloud
definition: A cloud which is organised as a transparent, whitish veil of fibrous (hair-like) or smooth appearance and which often producing halo phenomena when scattering visible range stellar radiation.

label: altocumulus cloud
definition: A cloud which is 1) white, grey, or both white and grey, 2) organised as a patch, sheet, or layer often with shading, 3) composed of laminae (a layer or layers), rounded masses, or rolls, which are sometimes partly fibrous or diffuse and which may or may not be merged.

label: altostratus cloud
definition: A cloud which is 1) greyish or bluish in colour, 2) organised as a sheet or layer of striated (grooves or channels in cloud formations, arranged parallel to the flow of the air), fibrous or uniform appearance, and 3) having parts thin enough to reveal the local star, at least vaguely, as through ground glass or frosted glass.

label: nimbostratus cloud
definition: A cloud which is 1) grey, often dark grey in colour, 2) organised as a layer, 3) diffused by more or less continuously falling rain or snow, which in most cases reaches the ground, and 3) thick enough throughout to blot out the appearance of the local star.

label: stratocumulus cloud
definition: A cloud which is 1) grey or whitish, or both grey and whitish in colour, 2) structurally organised as a patch, sheet or layer that a) almost always has dark parts and b) is composed of non-fibrous tessellations, rounded masses, rolls, and similar structural elements and which may or may not be merged.

label: stratus cloud
definition: A cloud which is 1) generally grey in colour, 2) structurally organised as a layer  with a fairly uniform base or, less frequently, ragged patches, 3) disposed to produce drizzle, snow or snow grains as preciptation, 4) only produces halo phenomena at very low temperatures, and 5) allows a clearly visible outline of the local star to be seen through its mass.

label: cumulus cloud
definition: A cloud which

label: homogenitus cloud
definition: A cloud which is formed by condensation events triggered by some anthropogenic processes or the outputs thereof, such as aircraft contrails or emissions from chimneys.

label: benthic deep-sea mining
definition: A mining process during which materials are extracted from benthic environments deep below the ocean surface, where no stellar radiation reaches..

label: silvagenitus cloud
definition: A cloud which develop locally over forests as a result of increased humidity due to evaporation and evapotranspiration from the tree canopy.

label: cirrus fibratus cloud
definition: A cirrus cloud which occurs as a detached unit or a thin veil and consists of nearly straight or irregularly curved filaments that do not terminate in hooks or tufts.

label: cumulonimbus cloud
definition: A cloud which 1) is heavy and dense, 2) has a considerable vertical extent, 3) has the form of a mountain or one or more huge towers, 3)  is usually smooth, fibrous or striated, and nearly always flattened across part of its upper portion, which often spreads out in the shape of an anvil or vast plume, 4)  has a very dark base which may be merged with low ragged clouds which frequently form undernead this could, and 5) is frequenly associated with precipitation, sometimes in the form of virga.

label: sea bed mining
definition: A mining process during which materials are extracted from the surface, or below the surface, of the ocean floor.

label: cirrus uncinus cloud
definition: A cirrus cloud which does not have grey parts and which is often shaped like a comma, terminating at its highest point in a hook, or in a tuft, the upper part of which is not in the form of a rounded protuberance.

label: cirrus spissatus cloud
definition: A cirrus cloud which 1) is structurally organised in patches, 2) is sufficiently dense to appear greyish when viewed towards the local star and 3) may veil, the local star, obscure its outline, or even hide it entirely.

label: cirrostratus fibratus cloud
definition: A cirrostratus cloud which occurs as a detached unit or a thin veil and consists of nearly straight or irregularly curved filaments that do not terminate in hooks or tufts.

label: stratocumulus castellanus cloud
definition: A stratocumulus cloud which 1) has linearly arranged cumuliform protuberances which resemble crenellated turrets or towers, some of which are taller than they are wide in some portion of their upper parts, 2) possess a lower region or base which connects these protuberances.

label: cirrus castellanus cloud
definition: A cirrus cloud which 1) has linearly arranged cumuliform protuberances which resemble crenellated turrets or towers, some of which are taller than they are wide in some portion of their upper parts, 2) possess a lower region or base which connects these protuberances.

label: cirrocumulus castellanus cloud
definition: A cirrocumulus cloud which 1) has linearly arranged cumuliform protuberances which resemble crenellated turrets or towers, some of which are taller than they are wide in some portion of their upper parts, 2) possess a lower region or base which connects these protuberances.

label: altocumulus castellanus cloud
definition: An altocumulus cloud which 1) has linearly arranged cumuliform protuberances which resemble crenellated turrets or towers, some of which are taller than they are wide in some portion of their upper parts, 2) possess a lower region or base which connects these protuberances.

label: water-based cloud
definition: A cloud which is primarily composed of water-based aerosols.

label: land conversion process
definition: An anthropisation process during which terrestrial environments - natural or anthropised - or parts thereof are altered to facilitate human activities such as agriculture, settlement, or commerce.

label: agricultural land conversion process
definition: A land conversion process during which terrestrial ecosystems are altered to facilitate agricultural activities such as crop cultivation or the rearing of livestock.

label: land use process
definition: An anthropogenic environmental process which includes all human activities undertaken in a natural, semi-natural, or anthropised environment.

label: forestry
definition: A land use process during which humans access and manage forest ecosystems for 1) the provisioning of wood, forages, water, wildlife, and recreation as well as a broad range of other ecosystem services or 2) the maintenance of the forest ecosystem's health.

label: terrestrial mining
definition: A land use process during which materials of economic value are extracted from a planet, usually from an orebody, lode, vein, seam, reef or placer deposit.

label: anthropogenic ecosystem conversion process
definition: A process during which an ecosystem - natural or anthropised - is changed by the actions of humans.

label: planned deforestation
definition: A planned process during which humans convert forests into one or more alternative ecosystem types.

label: planned environmental usage process
definition: A planned process during which humans access and obtain resources, benefits, or services from a natural or anthropised ecosystem.

label: mining
definition: A planned environmental usage process during which a non-renewable resource such as petroleum, natural gas, or water is extracted from an ecosystem.

label: quarrying
definition: A mining process during which rock or mineral deposits are extracted from the terrestrial surface layers of an astronomical body.

label: marine mining
definition: A mining process which occurs in a marine ecosystem.

label: coal mining
definition: A mining process during which coal is extracted from the rocky portion of an astronomical body.

label: opencast mining
definition: A mining process during which metal ores and minerals that lie near the terrestrial surface of an astronomical body are extracted by removing the overlying material and breaking and loading the ore.

label: agriculture
definition: A land use process during which terrestrial environments are modified such that they can grow crop plants or allow the rearing of animals to provide food, fiber, medicines, or other products used by humans.

label: usage of an environment for recreation
definition: A planned environmental usage process during which humans access an environment in order to promote the refreshment of their physical and psychological health through relaxation and leisure activities.

label: usage of an environment for transportation
definition: A planned environmental usage process during which an environment facilitates the movement of materials and material objects (persons or goods) from place to place, typically with the assistance of a vehicle.

label: usage of an environment for infrastructure and utilities
definition: A planned environmental usage process during which an environment supports 1) enterprises concerned with the provision to the public of essentials, such as electricity or water or 2) the basic network or foundation of capital facilities or community investments which are necessary to support economic and community activities.

label: usage of an environment for residential activity
definition: A planned environmental usage process during which an environment supports the settlement and dwelling of a community of humans.

label: usage of an environment for community and social services
definition: A planned environmental usage process during which an environment supports welfare activities organised by the state or a local authority and carried out by trained personnel.

label: usage of an environment for retail activity
definition: A planned environmental usage process during which an environment supports the sale of goods to ultimate consumers, usually in small quantities.

label: usage of an environment for defence
definition: A planned environmental usage process during which an environment supports activities which aim to protect citizens or any geographical area by preparing for or by using military means to resist the attack of an enemy.

label: usage of an environment for industry
definition: A planned environmental usage process during which an environment supports manufacturing facilities producing commodities that are sold with the expectation of recovering the total cost of production.

label: usage of an environment for business
definition: A planned environmental usage process during which an environment supports facilities associated with commerce or the earning of a livelihood through means other than manufacturing or the provision of a public service.

label: Calyptra habitat
definition: A habitat which supports the persistence and growth of a population of Calyptra moths and which overlaps mesic meadows and edges and clearings in vegetated areas.

label: terrestrial mountain
definition: A mountain which is located on land and which is bounded by an atmosphere or outer space.

label: polar mountain
definition: A mountain that is part of a polar environment.

label: temperate mountain
definition: A mountain that is part of a temperate environment.

label: tropical mountain
definition: A mountain that is part of a tropical environment.

label: cloud forest
definition: A montane forest ecosystem which 1) is evergreen, 2) present on mountains where there is frequent cloud and mist cover, 3) which has a large proportion of ferns and mosses in its plant communities, growing on all tree trunks and branches present in the ecosystem, and 3) harvests aerosolised water and adds it to the terrestrial water supply.

label: mist
definition: A visible mass of water droplets or ice crystals suspended in the air at or near a planetary surface, formed when humid air cools rapidly.

label: high-elevation mountain
definition: A mountain which has a maximum elevation greater than 2500 metres above sea level.

label: mid-elevation mountain
definition: A mountain which has a maximum elevation between 300 and 2499 metres above sea level and slopes greater than or equal to two degrees of inclination.

label: UNEP-WCMC class 1 mountain
definition: A high-elevation mountain which has a maximum elevation greater than 4500 metres above sea level.

label: UNEP-WCMC class 2 mountain
definition: A high-elevation mountain which has a maximum elevation between 3500 and 4500 metres above sea level.

label: UNEP-WCMC class 3 mountain
definition: A high-elevation mountain which has a maximum elevation between 2500 and 3500 metres above sea level.

label: UNEP-WCMC class 4 mountain
