definition: A mid-elevation mountain which has a maximum elevation between 1500 and 2499 metres above sea level and a slope greater than or equal to two degrees.

label: UNEP-WCMC class 5 mountain
definition: A mid-elevation mountain which has a maximum elevation between 1000 and 1499 metres above sea level and either 1) a slope greater than or equal to five degrees or 2) a local elevation range, within a 7 kilometre radius, of greater than 300 metres above sea level.

label: UNEP-WCMC class 6 mountain
definition: A mid-elevation mountain which has a maximum elevation between 300 and 999 metres above sea level and a local elevation range, within a 7 kilometre radius, of greater than 300 metres above sea level.

label: UNEP-WCMC class 7 mountain
definition: An elevated inner basin or plateau surrounded by mountains, but not - itself - a mountain.

label: intertidal ecosystem
definition: An ecosystem which overlaps those areas of the foreshore and seabed that are exposed to the air at low tide and submerged at high tide.

label: observing system
definition: A system of constructed and manufactured products which are used by humans to produce data, information, or knowledge about material, immaterial, or processual entities.

label: observatory system
definition: An observing system which generates long-term data about one or more entities of interest, typically using standardised methodology.

label: omics observatory system
definition: An observatory system which includes components used to generate (meta)genomic, (meta)transcriptomic, (meta)proteomic, metabolomic, and other omic data, information, and knowledge.

label: liquid astronomical body part
definition: A part of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of a continuous volume of liquid material, shaped by one or more environmental processes.

label: gaseous astronomical body part
definition: A part of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of a continuous volume of gaseous material, shaped by one or more environmental processes.

label: fluid astronomical body part
definition: A part of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of a continuous volume of liquid or gaseous material, shaped by one or more environmental processes.

label: domestic building
definition: A building which is primarily used for the long-term habitation of humans.

label: public prision
definition: A public prison is a building which used to forcibly confine humans and deprive them of selected rights and freedoms, under the authority of a state.

label: tornado
definition: A tornado is an aeroform consisting of at least one rapidly rotating column of air that is in contact with both the surface of an astronomical body and pendant from within or beneath a cumulonimbus or cumulus cloud.

label: surface of an astronomical body
definition: A surface layer where the solid or liquid material of an astronomical body comes into contact with an atmosphere or outer space.

label: fire whirl
definition: A fire whirl is a whirlwind induced by the contraction and rotation of intense, rising heat and turbulent, eddying air masses resulting from a large fire and made up of a core of burning matter surrounded by a rotating pocket of air.

label: multiple vortex tornado
definition: A tornado which comprises two or more columns of spinning air rotating about their own axis and at the same time around a common center.

label: landspout
definition: A tornado which a) is not associated with a mesocyclone and is thus relatively weak and short-lived, b) is centred on a small, smooth condensation funnel which often does not reach the planetary surface, and c) forms a distinctively laminar cloud of dust when it makes contact with the land.

label: waterspout
definition: A tornado which connects a cumulus or cumulonimbus cloud to a body of water, often transporting water from that water body along the spiraling winds constituting  its vortex.

label: aircraft
definition: A vehicle which is able to travel through air in an atmosphere.

label: spur
definition: A slope of land descending laterally from a hill, mountain or main crest of a ridge.

label: intrusion
definition: A mass of environmental material which has been formed as the result of its transport into an existing mass of another material.

label: flattened elevation
definition: An elevation which is flattened across its highest surface.

label: satellite imaging
definition: A remote sensing process during which image data about an astronomical body or object is generated by sensors mounted on a satellite.

label: satellite imaging of a planet
definition: A remote sensing process during which image data about a planet is generated by sensors mounted on a satellite.

label: dioxygen dissolved in marine water
definition: Dioxygen which is the solute in a solution with ocean water as its solvent.

label: inorganic macronutrient dissolved in ocean water
definition: A macronutrient role which inheres in nitrate, nitrogen dioxide, ammonium, silicon, or phosphate dissolved in ocean water.

label: carbonate system of ocean water
definition: A system which is composed of carbon-based chemical entities dissolved in or otherwise part of an ocean or sea and the atmosphere adjacent to it, undergoing constant exchange through biogeochemical cycling.

label: thermokarst formation process
definition: A process by which landforms are formed from the thawing of ice-rich permafrost or the melting of massive ground ice.

label: active agri-ecosystem management process
definition: An active ecosystem management process which targets an agricultural ecosystem.

label: anthropogenic light pollution
definition: A pollution process during which artificial light with wavelengths in the visible spectrum is released into the environment.

label: radiation from a manufactured product
definition: An electromagnetic radiation process during which electromagnetic waves or their quanta are emitted from a manufactured product.

label: visible spectrum radiation from a manufactured product
definition: Radiation from a manufactured product during which light between the wavelenghts of 380 nm and 760 nm is emitted.

label: glacial surface layer
definition: A solid surface layer which is that part of a glacier in contact with a planetary atmosphere, water body, or solid material partially surrounding that glacier.

label: glacial surface layer velocity
definition: A velocity quality which inheres in the surface layer of a glacier.

label: alpine tundra biome
definition: A tundra biome which exists at high altitudes and where vegetation - dominated by a few species of dwarf shrubs, a few grasses, sedges, lichens, and mosses - is stunted due to low temperatures and high winds.

label: ice calf
definition: An ice mass which has calved off an larger mass of ice.

label: floating ice calf
definition: An ice calf which is suspended in a water mass, being partially exposed to an atmosphere.

label: anchored ice calf
definition: An ice calf which is frozen to the bed of an ocean or other water body.

label: terrestrial ice calf
definition: An ice calf which rests on land.

label: material congelation process
definition: A material transformation process during which a material's viscosity increase either through a reduction in temperature, through chemical reactions, or other physical effects.

label: congelation sea ice
definition: Sea ice which 1) has formed on the submerged surface (i.e. the base) of an existing mass of sea ice and 2) is composed of columnar crystals due to the downward growth of the crystals into the water.

label: permafrost congelation ice
definition: Water ice which has formed in a mass of permafrost.

label: congelation ice in a fresh water body
definition: Freshwater ice which forms downward from the surface of a freshwater water body and is transparent due to a reduced number of air bubbles trapped in its mass.

label: freshwater congelation ice
definition: Freshwater ice which forms on a solid substrate through the freezing of freshwater.

label: ice cave congelation ice
definition: Freshwater congelation ice which has formed on a solid substrate in an ice cave.

label: drift ice mass
definition: A floating mass of ice which is 1) unattached to land or land-fast ice and 2) moved by the action of winds or currents.

label: drifting sea ice mass
definition: A drift ice mass which is composed primarily of sea ice.

label: area of pack ice
definition: An area in which masses of drift ice aggregate such that they cover a minimum of 7/10ths-8/10ths of the surface the water body they are floating in.

label: area of sea ice
definition: An environmental zone that overlaps that part of a water body covered or partially covered by sea ice.

label: area of drift ice
definition: An area in which masses of drift ice aggregate such that they cover less than 7/10ths of the surface the water body they are floating in.

label: fast ice
definition: A mass of sea ice which 1) is less than 2 meters in thickness and 2) forms along the coast, where it is attached to the shore, to an ice wall, to an ice front, or between shoals or grounded icebergs.

label: frazil
definition: Small, needle-like (spicules), plate-like, or discoid crystals derived from nearly pure fresh water, suspended in a water body.

label: frozen land
definition: Land which is below the freezing point of water.

label: hard-frozen soil
definition: Frozen soil which is firmly cemented by water ice, is subject to brittle failure, and exhibits practically no consolidation under load.

label: frozen soil
definition: Soil which is below the freezing point of water.

label: plastic-frozen soil
definition: Frozen soil which is cemented by water ice but has viscous properties due to its high, unfrozen water content and therefore will compress and deform under load.

label: friable-frozen soil
definition: Frozen soil which has very low total water content and is not cemented by ice; its compressibility is the same as that of unfrozen soils having the same composition, total water content and density.

label: glacier snout
definition: An ice mass which constitutes that part of a glacier which has the lowest elevation.

label: water ice core
definition: An ice mass which has been drilled from an accumulation of snow and ice that has built up over many years and that has recrystallized and has trapped air bubbles from previous time periods.

label: sea ice field
definition: An ice field which is primarily composoed of sea ice floes greater than 10 kilometers across.

label: glacier ice field
definition: An ice field which is constituted by a continuous accumulation of snow and glacier ice that completely fills a mountain basin or covers a low-relief mountain plateau.

label: mass ice flow
definition: An advective transport process during which a mass of ice is transported from one location to another.

label: tabular iceberg
definition: An iceberg which 1) has a flat upper surface, 2) is derived from an ice shelf, ice tongue, or floating tidewater glacier via detachment.

label: floeberg
definition: An ice mass which is composed of a large amount of sea ice in the form of a hummock or a group of such hummocks, frozen together and separated from any surrounding ice by sea water.

label: sea ice hummock
definition: An elevation which is formed by pressure at the point of contact between ice floes, resulting in a conglomeration of broken ice.

label: frost-formed hummock
definition: A hummock which is primarily composed of soil that has been pushed up by frost action.

label: branched valley glacier
definition: A valley glacier which has one or more tributary glaciers as parts.

label: simple valley glacier
definition: A valley glacier which does not have any tributary glaciers flowing into it.

label: tributary glacier
definition: A glacier which flows into a larger glacier.

label: ice surface layer
definition: A surface layer which is composed primarily of ice.

label: water ice surface layer
definition: An ice surface layer which is primarily composed of water ice.

label: two-dimensional fiat ice surface
definition: An two-dimensional continuant fiat boundary which overlaps the surface layer of a mass of ice.

label: two-dimensional fiat water ice surface
definition: A two-dimensional fiat ice surface which is composed primarily of water ice.

label: iceberg
definition: An ice mass which has broken away from a larger ice mass on land, such as a glacier or ice shelf, and may be either afloat or aground.

label: land ice mass
definition: An ice mass which has formed over land.

label: freezing
definition: A material congelation process during which a liquid turns into a solid when its temperature is lowered below its melting point.

label: freezing of water into water ice
definition: A freezing process during which liquid water is transformed into water ice.

label: sea-ice lead
definition: An ice lead which occurs in a marine water body and is bounded by sea ice.

label: ice lead
definition: A surface layer of a water body which has been formed as the result of surface ice fracturing and moving apart.

label: flaw lead
definition: An ice lead between a mass of fast ice and a mass of pack ice.

label: shore lead
definition: An ice lead which occurs between the shore and pack ice.

label: surface layer of a water body
definition: A water surface that is part of a water body.

label: frozen lead
definition: An ice lead within which new, nilas, and young ice has formed.

label: pack ice mass
definition: A drift ice mass which has an ice concentration above or equal to 7/10: which covers 70% or more of a given area of a water body.

label: water-body-derived ice
definition: Ice which has formed as the result of freezing of water which was part of a water body.

label: area of seasonal sea ice
definition: An environmental zone which overlaps that part of an ocean or sea within which 1) sea ice is present only part of the year, 2) extends from the permanent ice zone to the boundary where winter sea ice extent is at a maximum, and 3) primarily overlaps first-year ice when seasonal ice is present.

label: cryopeg
definition: A layer which is composed of ground that 1) remains unfrozen due to increased solute concentration and 2) is present within a mass of permafrost.

label: colloidal suspension
definition: An environmental material which is primarily composed of a dispersed phase of insoluable particles, approximately between 1 nanometer and 1 micrometer in maximum dimension, distributed throughout a material acting as a medium of suspension.

label: gel
definition: An environmental material which is solid, jelly-like, and exhibits no flow when in steady state material and which contains liquid dispersed in and held in place by cross-linked structures of a solid medium.

label: hydrogel
definition: A gel which is primarily composed of a network of polymer chains that are hydrophilic, sometimes found as a colloidal gel in which water is the dispersion medium.

label: quicksand
definition: An environmental material which 1) is primarily composed of a fine, granular material such as sand, silt, or clay suspended in and saturated by water and 2) readily liquefies when weight is applied, losing strength and permitting objects to sink until their weight and buoyancy offset the weight of the displaced quicksand.

label: rain
definition: An aggregate of raindrops falling to a planetary surface during a precipitation process.

label: water-based rain
definition: Rain which is composed of water droplets falling to a planetary surface during a rainfall process.

label: infrasound
definition: Sound which is lower in frequency than 20 Hertz, or cycles per second.

label: protected area
definition: An environmental zone which 1) contains ecosystems, constructed features, or other entities deemed to be of natural, historical, cultural, or other significance and 2) has been afforded legal protections restricting one or more forms of use by a competent authority.

label: frost heave
definition: An elevation which is formed as an ice mass forms under soil, resulting in upwards deformation of the land surface.

label: terrestrial ecoregion
definition: An ecoregion which is located on a landmass.

label: sea surface layer
definition: A surface layer of a water body which is part of an ocean or sea.

label: forest floor
definition: Land which is present within a forest biome.

label: Yemen, Saudi Arabia, and Oman Ecoregion
Masai Xeric Grasslands and Shrublands Ecoregion
Ile Europa and Bassas da India Ecoregion
Oman and United Arab Emirates Ecoregion
Ethiopian Xeric Grasslands and Shrublands Ecoregion
East Saharan Montane Xeric Woodland Ecoregion
Oman, Yemen, and Saudi Arabia Ecoregion
water current
definition: A hydroform which is maintained by a continuous, directed movement of water, generated by disequilibria in a water mass.

label: kerosene oil
definition: A fuel oil which 1) is derived from petroleum oil, 2) has a strong odor, 3) produces large quantities of soot relative to other fuel oils, 4) is less refined than fuel oils such as paraffin.

label: cryospheric layer
definition: A layer which is part of a cryosphere.

label: active layer in a cryosphere
definition: A layer of environmental material which is subject to freeze-thaw cycles.

label: thawing process
definition: A warming process during which the thermal energy in a portion of environmental material is sufficient to melt water-based ice or snow.

label: material warming process
definition: A process during which the temperature of a portion of environmental material is increased, along with the kinetic energy of its constituent molecules.

label: permafrost thawing process
definition: A thawing process during which permafrost is warmed beyond the melting point of water-based ice, snow, or other forms of solid water.

label: ice-bearing permafrost
definition: Permafrost which contains inclusions of water-based ice.

label: material cooling process
definition: A process during which the temperature of a portion of environmental material is decreased, along with the kinetic energy of its constituent molecules.

label: bare soil
definition: Soil which is directly exposed to the atmosphere - with no intervening layer of plant life or other cover - and thus the effects of weathering and erosion.

label: snow accumulation process
definition: A material accumulation process during which the mass of snow on a surface increases.

label: ice accumulation process
definition: A material accumulation process during which ice forms in an environmental material or an existing accumulation of ice increases in mass.

label: snow and ice accumulation process
definition: A material accumulation process during which a accumulation of snow and ice forms or increases in mass.

label: mass of ice and snow
definition: A object which is composed primarily of water-based snow and ice.

label: englacial
definition: A positional quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer being located within a glacier or ice sheet, between their summer surface or bed.

label: englacial process
definition: An environmental system process which occurs within a glacier or ice sheet.

label: glacial summer surface
definition: A glacial surface layer which is present at the point in time where any given part of a glacier reaches its minimum annual mass.

label: glacial bed
definition: A glacial surface layer which is adjacent to the bedrock or debris over which a glacier flows.

label: polar tundra ecosystem
definition: A tundra ecosystem which is subject to polar climatic conditions.|

label: polymetallic nodule ecosystem
definition: An ecosystem which is determined by the presence of rounded mineral concretions primarily composed of manganese hydroxides on the seafloor.

label: submarine groundwater discharge process
definition: A water flow process during which fresh or brackish groundwater flows from from a landmass into the sea.

label: groundwater discharge process
definition: A water flow process during which water flows out of an aquifer.

label: groundwater flow
definition: A water flow process during which water is transported through an aquifer.

label: agricultural pollution
definition: An environmental pollution process during which contaminants derived from agricultural activity are released into an environmental system.

label: agricultural landscape diversification process
definition: An active agri-ecosystem management process during which the variability of land use types or the spatial structure of land under agricultural production is increased.

label: biodiversity conservation process
definition: A conservation process during which the variability of life - from genes to ecosystems - is preserved.

label: insect conservation process
definition: A biodiversity conservation process during which the variability of insect communities, or parts thereof, is preserved.

label: agricultural specialisation process
definition: An active agri-ecosystem management process during which an ecosystem is modified for the production of one or a small collection of crops or other agricultural products.

label: frost-susceptible soil
definition: Soil in which segregated ice will form (causing frost heave) under the required conditions of moisture supply and temperature.

label: formation of a solid aerosol from liquid material in an atmosphere
definition: A process during which microscopic solid particulates are formed from liquid materials in an atmosphere.

label: glaciation of water droplets in a cloud
definition: A process during which supercooled water droplets in a cloud freeze into ice crystals.

label: glaciation
definition: An interval of time within an ice age and during which temperatures fall resulting in planet-wide glacier advances.

label: interglacial
definition: An interval of time within an ice age and during which temperatures rise and result in planet-wide glacier retreat.

label: ice age
definition: A temporal interval during which a planet's surface and atmospheric temperatures fall, resulting in the presence or expansion of continental and polar ice sheets or alpine glaciers.

label: material primarily composed of biogenic carbonates
gaseous part of an atmosphere
definition: That part of an atmosphere which is composed of gaseous material.

label: amorphous solid
definition: A solid material which does not have a regularly organised internal structure.

label: colloid suspended in a hydrosphere
definition: A colloidal suspension which is dispersed through a part of a hydrosphere.

label: suspended colloidal sediment
definition: Colloidal sediment which is suspended in a part of the hydrosphere.

label: heavy fraction material
definition: An environmental material which is denser than bromoform.

label: light fraction material
definition: An environmental material which is less dense than bromoform.

label: particulate matter in a hydrosphere
definition: Particulate matter which is surrounded by water that is part of a hydrosphere.

label: atmospheric aerosol
definition: An aerosol that is suspended in an atmosphere.

label: well-mixed estuary
definition: An estuary in which mixing by tidal forcing exceeds the force of riverine output, resulting in thorough homogenisation of the estuary's water column and the disappearance of a vertical salinity gradient and the freshwater-seawater boundary.

label: aerosol formation process
definition: A material transformation process during which solid or liquid particles form and are suspended in a mass of air, thus creating an aerosol.

label: glacial process
definition: An environmental process which involves glaciers or ice sheets.

label: glacial retreat
definition: A glacial ice loss process during which the snout (toe) of a glacier shrinks following successive years of negative mass balance.

label: calving of ice onto land
definition: An ice calving process during which a mass of ice falls from a larger mass onto land.

label: calving of ice into water
definition: An ice calving process during which a mass of ice falls from a larger mass into a body of water.

label: periglacial process
definition: A frost action process which occurs in cold environments which are not part of a glacier.

label: frost action process
definition: A material transport process during which alternate freezing and thawing of moisture in soil, rock and other materials results  modifications of those materials and in the formation of structures on, or in, the ground.

label: frost jacking
definition: A frost action process during which objects embedded in the ground are cumulatively displaced upwards.

label: frost sorting
definition: A frost action process during which the soil particles are differentially displaced according to their size ranges.

label: frost wedging
definition: A frost action process during which the pressure of water freezing in cracks, crevices, pores, joints or bedding planes results in the mechanical disintegration, splitting or break-up of rock.

label: cryoturbation of soil
definition: A frost action process during which soil is displaced.

label: soil cryoturbate
definition: A mass of soil moved or disturbed by frost action.

label: glacial run
definition: A water flow process which comprises a suddenonset highmagnitude discharge of water and sediment from a glacial source

label: thalassic
definition: A physical quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer being derived from, part of, or otherwise dependent on the seas or oceans.

label: atmospheric frontal zone
definition: An environmental zone which contains a weather front, bounded by frontal surfaces.

label: mariculture process
definition: An aquaculture process during which marine organisms are cultivated in the open ocean, an enclosure in the ocean, or in tanks, ponds or raceways which are filled with seawater.

label: open cage mariculture process
definition: A mariculture process during which organisms are cultivated in cages which allow the passage of materials such as wastes, pathogens, antibiotics, and - should a containment breach occur - cultivated organisms themselves to and from the surrounding marine environment.

label: open cage mariculture facility
definition: A construction which contains the equipment needed to perform mariculture in open cages - permitting the exchange of material with the surrounding marine water.

label: frontal surface of a weather front
definition: A gaseous surface layer which is composed of the warmer air mass(es) along the horizontal density and temperature discontinuity in a weather front.

label: fluid surface layer
definition: A surface layer which is composed primarily of some liquid or gas.

label: lysocline
definition: A cline across which one or more solid environmental materials dissolve into their surrounding fluid.

label: nutricline
definition: A cline across which nutrient content of a fluid changes rapidly.

label: marine cline
definition: A cline which is part of a marine water body.

label: fluid interface layer
definition: A surface layer which separates two portions of fluid with respect to either 1) a discontinuity of some fluid property or 2) some derivative of one of these properties in a direction normal to the interface.

label: fluid layer
definition: A layer which is composed primarily of some fluid.

label: fluid front
definition: A fluid interface which separates two fluid masses with differing properties.

label: gaseous front
definition: A fluid front which is composed primarily of gaseous material and separates at least two gaseous masses.

label: weather front
definition: A gaseous front which separates two masses of air with different densities and is a principal cause of meteorological phenomena.

label: air mass
definition: An object which is composed of a continuous mass of air.

label: gaseous surface layer
definition: A fluid surface layer which is composed primarily of some gaseous material.

label: interface layer
definition: A layer which separates two portions of environmental material which possess 1) differing compositions, 2) a discontinuity of some property, or 3) some derivative of some property in a direction normal to the interface.

label: mass of environmental material
definition: An object which is composed primarily of an environmental material

label: mass of solid material
definition: An object which is composed primarily of a solid environmental material

label: mass of fluid
definition: An object which is composed primarily of a fluid.

label: mass of gas
definition: An object which is composed primarily of a gas.

label: mass of liquid
definition: An object which is composed primarily of a liquid.

label: mass of compounded environmental materials
definition: An mass of environmental materials which has appreciable quantities of several individual materials, such that the removal of one would convert the mass into a different entity.

label: isobaric surface
definition: A material isosurface within which pressure is approximately constant.

label: isohaline surface
definition: A material isosurface within which salinity is approximately constant.

label: isopycnal surface
definition: A material isosurface within which density is approximately constant.

label: isothermal surface
definition: A material isosurface within which temperature is approximately constant.

label: atmospheric isobaric surface
definition: An isobaric surface that is part of an atmosphere.

label: polar front
definition: A weather front which separates air masses of tropical and polar origin.

label: Arctic front
definition: A polar front between the deep, cold Arctic air and the shallower, warmer polar air of northern latitudes on Earth.

label: Antarctic front
definition: A polar front between the deep, cold Antarctic air and the shallower, warmer polar air of southern latitudes on Earth.

label: tropical environment
definition: An environment which has a climate with continually high temperatures and with considerable precipitation, at least during part of the year.

label: subtropical environment
definition: An environment which has a climate with warm temperatures and with meagre precipitation.

label: polar environment
definition: An environment which is located in a part of an astronomical body subject to polar climatic conditions.

label: subpolar environment
definition: An environment which is located in a part of an astronomical body subject to subpolar climatic conditions.

label: temperate environment
definition: An environment which is located in a part of an astronomical body subject to temperate climatic conditions.

label: cold front
definition: A weather front which is nonoccluded and  which moves in the direction of the warmer air mass it is adjacent to, such that colder air will occupy the site where warmer air was previously present.

label: warm front
definition: A weather front which is nonoccluded and which moves in the direction of the colder air mass it is adjacent to, such that warmer air will occupy the site where colder air was previously present.

label: anafront
definition: A weather front at which warm air is ascending to high altitudes along the frontal surface.

label: katafront
definition: A weather front at which warm air is descending to lower altitudes along the frontal surface.

label: intertropical front
definition: A weather front which exists in an equatorial trough separating the air of the Northern and Southern Hemispheres of an astronomical body.

label: upper air
definition: An air mass which is part of the free atmosphere, including the troposphere and stratosphere.

label: free atmosphere
definition: An atmospheric layer which 1) is located above the planetary boundary layer, 2) in which the effect of friction between moving air masses and the planetary surface is negligible, and 3) in which the air is usually treated (dynamically) as an ideal fluid.

label: upper front
definition: A weather front which is part of a mass of upper air.

label: occluded front
definition: A weather front which separates air behind a cold front from air ahead of a warm front.

label: cold occluded front
definition: An occluded front which is adjacent to a cold front 1) that is moving away from the coldest air in the vicinity,  2) where the neighbouring cold front undercuts the neighbouring warm front in the occulsion zone, and 3) where the coldest air in the vicinity replaces less cold air towards the surface of the astronomical body.

label: warm occluded front
definition: An occluded front which is adjacent to a warm front 1) that is moving in the direction of the coldest air in the vicinity, 2) where the original cold front is forced aloft at the warm front surface, and 3) where the coldest air is replaced by less cold air at the surface of the astronomical body.

label: neutral occluded front
definition: An occluded front which is 1) adjacent to a cold and a warm front with no appreciable difference between the temperatures of their bordering air masses and 2) which creates a pressure trough, a wind-shift line, a band of cloudiness, and precipitation at the surface of the astronomical body.

label: secondary cold front
definition: A cold front which forms behind a frontal cyclone and within a cold air mass with an appreciable horizontal temperature gradient.

label: katabatic wind
definition: An atmospheric wind during which cold atmospheric gas flows downwards towards the surface of an astronomical body.

label: downslope katabatic wind
definition: A katabatic wind during which atmospheric gas flows down the slope of an elevation, typically during periods of light larger-scale winds.

label: cooling-driven katabatic wind
definition: A katabatic wind which is driven by the cooling and subsequent sinking of atmospheric gas masses.

label: foehn wind
definition: A downslope katabatic wind during which warm, dry atmospheric gas descends along the lee side of a mountain range as a result of synoptic-scale, cross-barrier flow over that range.

label: adiabatic process
definition: An environmental process during which a system does not thermally interact with its surroundings by virtue of a temperature difference between them.

label: dry-adiabatic process
definition: An adiabatic process during which no condensation of water vapor occurs and no liquid water is present.

label: moist-adiabatic process
definition: An adiabatic process which involves air saturated with water vapour and the presence of liquid water.

label: fall wind
definition: A katabatic wind during which the low temperature and increased density of a cold mass of atmospheric gas accelerates its descent.

label: bora
definition: A fall wind which has a source so cold that, when the atmospheric gas reaches the lowlands or coast, the dynamic warming is insufficient to raise its temperature to the normal level for the region; hence it appears as a cold wind.

label: squall wind
definition: An atmospheric wind which rapidly forms, lasts for a duration in the order of minutes, and then rapidly decreases in speed.

label: nautical squall
definition: A storm which is nautical, localised, and of high severity local storm considered as a whole: that is, winds and cloud mass and (if any) precipitation, thunder and lightning.

label: jet-effect wind
definition: A wind which is driven by the acceleration of flow through a gap, constriction, or channel resulting from large-scale pressure gradient, or by Venturi acceleration through a constricting passage.

label: mountain-gap wind
definition: A jet-effect which passes through a gap, constriction, or channel between mountains in a mountain range or between ranges themselves.

label: slope flow
definition: An atmospheric wind which moves up or down a slope and is driven by heating or cooling of that slope.

label: anabatic wind
definition: An upslope wind driven by heating at the slope surface under fair-weather conditions.

label: insolation process
definition: A process during which direct stellar radiation interacts with a planetary surface.

label: cooling of a gas
definition: A material cooling process during which a portion of gaseous environmental material loses thermal energy to its surroundings.

label: cooling of a liquid
definition: A material cooling process during which a portion of liquid environmental material loses thermal energy to its surroundings.

label: cooling of a solid
definition: A material cooling process during which a portion of solid environmental material loses thermal energy to its surroundings.

label: cooling of a fluid
definition: A material cooling process during which a portion of gaseous environmental material loses thermal energy to its surroundings.

label: warming of a fluid
definition: A material warming process during which the thermal energy in a volume of fluid increases.

label: warming of a gas
definition: A process of warming a fluid during which the thermal energy in a volume of gas increases.

label: warming of a liquid
definition: A process of warming a fluid which includes a volume of liquid as a participant.

label: warming of a solid
definition: A material warming process during which the thermal energy in a mass of solid material increases.

label: drainage wind
definition: A downslope katabatic wind which is generated by the cooling of atmospheric gas in contact with terrain surfaces.

label: quasi-stationary front
definition: A front which shows very little mobility.

label: glacier wind
definition: A drainage wind which flows along the icy surface of a glacier.

label: cyclonic circulation
definition: A mass fluid flow which moves  in the same direction as a planet's rotation, rotating due to a Coriolis effect.

label: wind storm
definition: An atmospheric storm during which winds flow with increased rates.

label: straight-line wind
definition: A wind storm during which strong gusts of wind occur, transporting atmospheric gas in a linear fashion.

label: downburst
definition: A downdraft which is of high intensity and which spreads radially,, with high speed, across the planetary surface upon reaching it.

label: dry macroburst
definition: A macroburst during which no or very little rain is generated.

label: wet macroburst
definition: A macroburst during which large amounts of rain are generated.

label: microburst
definition: A downburst during which high winds occur over an area less than four kilometres in diameter.

label: macroburst
definition: A downburst during which high winds occur over an area larger than four kilometres in diameter.

label: wet microburst
definition: A microburst during which large amounts of rain are generated.

label: dry microburst
definition: A microburst during which no or very little rain is generated.

label: vibration process
definition: A material transport process during which parts of an elastic material oscillate around their positions of equilibrium.

label: seismic vibration process
definition: A vibration process which occurs in the solid parts of an astronomical body as low-frequency acoustic waves pass through them.

label: volcanic seismic vibration
definition: A seismic vibration process which is caused by a volcanic eruption.

label: impact-driven seismic vibration
definition: A seismic vibration process which is caused by the impact of a solid object on the surface of an astronomical body.

label: impact event
definition: An impact event is a collision between material entities, resulting in changes in one or both of those entities.

label: explosion-driven seismic vibration
definition: A seismic vibration process which is caused by an explosion.

label: mass-wasting-driven seismic vibration
definition: A seismic vibration process which is caused by mass wasting.

label: collapse-driven seismic vibration
definition: A seismic vibration process which is caused by the collapose of a material entity, sending kinetic energy into astronomical body.

label: structural collapse process
definition: A process during which the ability of a material entity to maintain its internal organisation fails, resulting in deformation and a breakdown of that organisation.

label: cave collapse
definition: A structural collapse process during which the walls of cave are unable to support the load placed upon them.

label: earthquake-driven seismic vibration
definition: A seismic vibration process which is caused by an earthquake.

label: foreshock
definition: A tectonic earthquake which precedes the strongest tectonic earthquake in a series, linked to the same release of energy in the crust.

label: mainshock
definition: A tectonic earthquake which 1) is embedded in a series of tectonic earthquakes, linked to the same release of energy in the crust and 2) has the largest magnitude of the series.

label: aftershock
definition: A tectonic earthquake which 1) is embedded in a series of tectonic earthquakes, linked to the same release of energy in the crust and 2) occurs after the mainshock.

label: thrust fault
definition: A fault across which older rocks are pushed above (away from the core of an astronomical body) younger rocks.

label: blind thrust earthquake
definition: A tectonic earthquake which occurs along a thrust fault which does not breach the surface of an astronomical body.

label: blind thrust fault
definition: A thrust fault which does not breach the surface of an astronomical body.

label: subsurface zone of an astronomical body
definition: An environmental zone which includes those regions of an astronomical body which are not exposed to its atmosphere or space.

label: multiplet tectonic earthquake
definition: A tectonic earthquake which has two or more mainshocks of similar magnitude, and which originate from the same fracture zone and stress field.

label: interplate earthquake
definition: A tectonic earthquake which occurs at the boundary between two tectonic plates.

label: intraplate earthquake
definition: A tectonic earthquake which occurs within the interior parts of a tectonic plate.

label: desert ecosystem
definition: An ecosystem in which the composition, structure, and function of resident ecological assemblages are primarily determined by a desert.

label: part of a landmass
definition: A solid astronomical body part which is part of the landmass of that body.

label: landmass
definition: A large continuous area of land, either surrounded by sea or contiguous with another landmass.

label: liquid surface of an astronomical body
definition: A surface of an astronomical body which is part of a water body present on that body.

label: compound astronomical body part
definition: A part of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of a continuous medium bearing liquid, gaseous, and solid material in varying quantities.

label: land
definition: A surface layer of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of solid material and is not covered by oceans or other bodies of water.

label: inland sea
definition: A sea which shalowly covers central areas of continents during periods of high sea level that result in marine transgressions.

label: mediterranean forest
definition: A forest ecosystem which includes communities adapted to 1) hot to warm, dry summers, 2) mild to cold, rainy winters, and 3) the influence of large, usually marine, bodies of water.

label: tropical broadleaf forest
definition: A broadleaf forest which is subject to tropical climate conditions.

label: subtropical broadleaf forest
definition: A broadleaf forest which is subject to subtropical climate conditions.

label: temperate broadleaf forest
definition: A broadleaf forest which is subject to temperate climate conditions.

label: ecosystem process
definition: An environmental process either driven by or primarily impacting the parts or emergent properties of an ecosystem.

label: temperate mixed forest
definition: A mixed forest which is subject to temperate climatic conditions.

label: tropical mixed forest
definition: A mixed forest which is subject to tropical climatic conditions.

label: tropical mixed forest biome
definition: A tropical mixed forest in which dominant ecological communities have reached their climax successional state.

label: tropical dry broadleaf forest
definition: A tropical broadleaf forest which 1) s subject to a year-round warm climate 2) may receive several hundred centimeters or rain per year and 3) are subject to long dry seasons which last several months.

label: tropical moist broadleaf forest
definition: A tropical broadleaf forest which 1) has low variability in annual temperature, 2) high levels of rainfall (>200 centimeter annually), and 3) has tree communities dominated by semi-evergreen and evergreen species.

label: subtropical dry broadleaf forest
definition: A subtropical broadleaf forest which 1) s subject to a year-round warm climate 2) may receive several hundred centimeters or rain per year and 3) are subject to long dry seasons which last several months.

label: subtropical moist broadleaf forest
definition: A subtropical broadleaf forest which 1) has low variability in annual temperature, 2) high levels of rainfall (>200 centimeter annually), and 3) has tree communities dominated by semi-evergreen and evergreen species.

label: tropical forest
definition: A forest ecosystem which is subject to tropical climate conditions.

label: subtropical forest
definition: A forest ecosystem which is subject to subtropical climate conditions.

label: temperate forest
definition: A forest ecosystem which is subject to temperate climate conditions.

label: tropical grassland
definition: A grassland ecosystem which is subject to tropical climatic conditions.

label: subtropical grassland
definition: A grassland which is subject to subtropical climatic conditions.

label: mediterranean grassland
definition: A grassland which is subject to mediterranean climatic conditions.

label: construction
definition: A material entity which has been assembled through the intentional, instinctual, or deliberately programmed efforts of an organism or machine.

label: organic object
definition: An object which is formed as a result of one or more biological processes and is composed primarily of organic material.

label: cell culturing
definition: Cell culturing is the aseptic maintainance and growth of collections of cells  outside of an organisms or natural environment in a suitable culture medium.

label: biomaterial containment unit
definition: A manufactured product which has been designed to contain a mass of biomaterial.

label: biomaterial culturing unit
definition: A biomaterial containment unit which is designed to allow the growth and propagation of the biomaterial it contains.

label: enrichment culturing unit
definition: A biomaterial culturing unit which is designed to promote the growth of selected cell populations (often at the expense of others) within a community by altering the conditions of the environment within its confines.

label: cell culturing unit
definition: A biomaterial culturing unit which is designed to promote the growth and propagation of cells in an artificial medium.

label: hydrothermally-influenced sediment
definition: Sediment through which hydrothermally modified fluids flow, altering its properties through interaction with their own.

label: active enrichment culturing unit
definition: An enrichment culturing unit which contains environmental material bearing ecological assemblages undergoing selection through experimentally imposed conditions.

label: active anaerobic enrichment culturing unit
definition: An active enrichment culturing unit which contains environmental material maintained under conditions with no free oxygen.

label: active sulphate-reducing enrichment culturing unit
definition: An active enrichment culturing unit which contains environmental material maintained under conditions that favour the reduction of sulphate.

label: tropical biome
definition: A biome which is subject to tropical climatic conditions.

label: temperate biome
definition: A biome which is subject to temperate climatic conditions.

label: subtropical biome
definition: A biome which is subject to subtropical climatic conditions.

label: mediterranean biome
definition: A biome which is subject to mediterranean climatic conditions.

label: subpolar biome
definition: A biome which is subject to subpolar climatic conditions.

label: alpine biome
definition: A biome which is subject to alpine altitudinal conditions.

label: montane biome
definition: A biome which is subject to montane altitudinal conditions.

label: subalpine biome
definition: A biome which is subject to subapline altitudinal conditions.

label: arid biome
definition: A biome which is subject to arid environmental conditions.

label: safe environment for living organisms
definition: An environment in which living organisms have a low likelihood of being harmed or killed

label: safe environment
definition: An environment in which material entities have a low likelihood of being damaged or destroyed.

label: volcanic soil
definition: An andosol which derives its silica content from glass and tephra ejected during a volcanic eruption.

label: momentum transfer process
definition: An environmental process during which momentum is transferred from one material entity to another.

label: atmosphere-ocean momentum transfer process
definition: A momentum transfer process which unfolds as winds generate drag at the bottom of the atmosphere,coupled to dynamical forcing at the surface of the ocean.

label: ocean surface stress
definition: A rate which inheres in an atmosphere-ocean momentum transfer process.

label: depth hoar
definition: Hoar which is usually cup-shaped and facetted and which forms within dry snow beneath the snow surface.

label: rime
definition: Frost which is 1) composed primarily of granular ice tufts, 2) formed on the windward sides of exposed objects through contact with supercooled fog or cloud, and 3) built out directly against the wind.

label: frost
definition: An environmental material which is primarily composed of minute ice crystals covering a cold surface.

label: geothermally active field
definition: A field in which geothermal processes occur.

label: energy transfer process
definition: A process during which one entity loses energy to another entity.

label: periglacial
definition: A positional quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer being located in the vicinity of - but not adjacent to or within - a glacier or ice sheet.

label: hydrothermal field
definition: A geothermally active field within which geothermally heated aqueous fluids are discharged from the the surface of a rocky planet.

label: hypodermic needle
definition: A hypodermic needle is a medical instrument made from a hollow needle. It is commonly used with a syringe to inject substances into the body of an organism.

label: textile
definition: A textile is a manufactured product comprised of a network of natural or artificial fibers (often referred to as thread or yarn).

label: bedclothing
definition: Bedclothing is a textile covering used on a bed as a sheet, blanket, or pillowcase.

label: pockmark field
definition: A pockmark field is an undersea feature formed by shallow seabed depressions, typically several tens of metres across and a few metres deep. Generally, they are formed in soft, fine-grained seabed sediments by the escape of fluids (gas or water, but mainly methane) into the water column.

label: nesting material
definition: Nesting material is an animal habitation consisting of matierals used to cushion, insulate and protect the young of the organism. The adult will use the material to form a protective structure to house and raise their young. Nests are built primarily by birds, but also by mammals, fish, insects and reptiles.

label: obsolete livestock-associated habitat
definition: Livestock is an animal-associated habitat consisting of any domestic or domesticated animal intentionally raised for food or in the production of food or raised as stock to produce food or fibre, in an agricultural setting or for its labour or pen-raised animals raised on licensed game farm operations. Livestock include: bovine animals (including buffalo and bison), ovine animals, porcine animals, caprine animals, , poultry, bees, equine animals, cervidae animals; animals of the genus Lama; ratites (Emu, Ostrich, and Rhea), fish or shellfish in aquaculture facilities, and enclosed domesticated rabbits or hares raised for human food or fiber.

label: obsolete cultured habitat
definition: Cultured habitat is an controlled habitat created by humans through laboratory techniques usually for the purposes of preparing cell, organ, tissue and plant tissue cultures.

label: tissue culture
definition: Tissue culture is the culture of cells, tissues or organs in a nutrient medium under sterile conditions.

label: cell culture
definition: A cell culture is a growth of cells in vitro in an artificial medium for experimental research.

label: plant tissue culture
definition: Plant tissue culture is the growth or maintenance of plant cells, tissues, organs or whole plants in vitro.

label: organ culture
definition: Organ culture is the aseptic culture of complete living organs of animals and plants outside the body in a suitable culture medium. Animal organs must be small enough to allow the nutrients in the culture medium to penetrate all the cells.

label: bodily fluid material
definition: An organic material which is primarily composed of some natural bodily fluid or secretion such as blood, semen, saliva, blood plasma, intracellular and interstitial fluids.

label: blood material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of blood, a bodily fluid composed of blood plasma and blood cells suspended within the plasma that circulates around the organism's body. Blood performs may important functions including the supplying of oxygen and nutrients, removal of waste, circulation of white blood cells, detection of antibodes, coagulation, transportation of antibodies and the regulation of pH and body temperature.

label: amniotic fluid material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of amniotic fluid, a bodily fluid consisting of watery liquid surrounding and cushioning a growing fetus within the amnion. It allows the fetus to move freely without the walls of the uterus being too tight against its body. Buoyancy is also provided.

label: excreta material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of excreta, bodily fluids consisting of matter which contains the waste products of biological processes, including urine or feces, discharged from an organism's body.

label: bile material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of bile, a bodily fluid consisting of a bitter, yellow or green alkaline fluid secreted by hepatocytes from the liver of most vertebrates. In many species, bile is stored in the gallbladder between meals and upon eating is discharged into the duodenum where the bile aids the process of digestion of lipids.

label: aqueous humour material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of aqueous humour, a bodily fluid consisting of a thick watery substance that fills the space between the lens and the cornea.

label: sweat material
definition: An excreta material which is composed primarily of sweat, an excreta consisting primarily of water as well as a smaller amount of sodium chloride that is excreted by the sweat glands in the skin of mammals.

label: chyme material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of chyme, a bodily fluid consisting of a liquid substance found in the stomach before passing through the pyloric valve and entering the duodenum. It results from the mechanical and chemical breakdown of a bolus and consists of partially digested food, water, hydrochloric acid, and various digestive enzymes.

label: blood plasma material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of blood plasma, a bodily fluid that comprises the liquid component of blood, in which the blood cells are suspended. It makes up about 55% of total blood volume.

label: ear wax material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of ear wax, a bodily fluid consisting of a yellowish, waxy substance secreted in the ear canal of humans and many other mammals. It plays an important role in the human ear canal, assisting in cleaning and lubrication, and also provides some protection from bacteria, fungi, and insects.

label: cerebrospinal fluid material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of cerebrospinal fluid, a clear bodily fluid that occupies the subarachnoid space and the ventricular system around and inside the brain. CSF is a clear bodily fluid that occupies the subarachnoid space and the ventricular system around and inside the brain.

label: chyle material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of chyle, a bodily fluid consisting of a milky fluid consisting of lymph and emulsified fats; formed in the small intestine during digestion of ingested fats.

label: breast milk material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of breast milk, is a bodily fluid produced that is secreted from two milk-secreting glandular organs on a female's chest.

label: vitreous humor material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of vitreous humor, a bodily fluid consisting of a clear gel that fills the space between the lens and the retina of the eyeball of humans and other vertebrates.

label: pleural effusion material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of a pleural effusion, a bodily fluid that is produced in excess and accumulates in the pleural cavity, the fluid-filled space that surrounds the lungs. Excessive amounts of such fluid can impair breathing by limiting the expansion of the lungs during inhalation.

label: tear material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of a volume of tears, a bodily fluid consisting of a drop of the clear salty liquid secreted by glands (lacrimal glands) in the eyes. Tears wet the membrane covering the eye and help rid the eye of irritating substances.

label: oronasal secretion material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of an oronasal secretion, a bodily fluid secreted from the body via the mouth or nose.

label: saliva material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of saliva, a slightly alkaline secretion of water, mucin, protein, salts, and often a starch-splitting enzyme (as ptyalin) that is secreted into the mouth by salivary glands, lubricates ingested food, and often begins the breakdown of starches.

label: sebum material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of sebum, an oily bodily fluid secreted from the sebaceous glads that is made of fat (lipids) and the debris of dead fat-producing cells. In the glands, sebum is produced within specialized cells and is released as these cells burst. Sebum acts to protect and waterproof hair and skin, and keep them from becoming dry, brittle and cracked. It can also inhibit the growth of microorganisms on skin.

label: pus material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of pus, a bodily fluid consisting of a whitish-yellow or yellow substance produced during inflammatory responses of the body that can be found in regions of pyogenic bacterial infections. Pus is produced from the dead and living cells which travel into the intercellular spaces around the affected cells.

label: synovial fluid material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of synovial fluid, a bodily fluid secreted by the synovial membrane into the joint cavity to form a thin layer at the surface of cartilage.

label: mucus material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of mucus, a bodily fluid consisting of a slippery secretion of the lining of the mucous membranes in the body. It is a viscous colloid containing antiseptic enzymes (such as lysozyme) and immunoglobulins. Mucus is produced by goblet cells in the mucous membranes that cover the surfaces of the membranes. It is made up of mucins and inorganic salts suspended in water.

label: lymph material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of lymph, a bodily fluid consisting of a usually clear coagulable fluid that passes from intercellular spaces of body tissue into the lymphatic vessels, is discharged into the blood by way of the thoracic duct and right lymphatic duct, and resembles blood plasma in containing white blood cells and especially lymphocytes but normally few red blood cells and no platelets.

label: interstitial fluid material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of interstitial fluid, a bodily fluid consisting of a solution which bathes and surrounds the cells of multicellular animals. It is the main component of the extracellular fluid, which also includes plasma and transcellular fluid.

label: biological product
definition: A biological product is an environmental substrate comprised of any virus, therapeutic serum, toxin, antitoxin, or analogous product available to prevent, treat or cure diseases or injuries in man.

label: siliceous ooze
definition: Siliceous ooze is a marine sediment composed of the debris of plankton with silica shells, such as diatoms and radiolaria. This ooze is limited to areas with high biological productivity, such as the polar oceans, and upwelling zones near the equator. The least common type of sediment, it covers only 15% of the ocean floor. It accumulates at a slower rate than calcareous ooze: 0.2-1 cm / 1000 yr.

label: red clay
definition: Red clay, also known as pelagic clay, accumulates in the deepest and most remote areas of the ocean. Containing less than 30% biogenic material, its composition is a varied mix of very fine quartz and clay minerals, authigenic deposits precipitated directly from seawater, and micrometeorites. Though called "red" because it sometimes takes the color of oxidized iron minerals, it is usually brownish in color. Its ultimate origin is uncertain, but red clay seems to be mostly derived from distant rivers, and windblown dust. Covering 38% of the ocean floor, it accumulates more slowly than any other sediment type, at only 0.1-0.5 cm / 1000 yr.

label: calcareous ooze
definition: Calcareous ooze is a marine sediment composed primarily of the shells--also known as tests--of foraminifera, coccolithophores, and pteropods. This is the most common pelagic sediment by area, covering 48% of the world ocean's floor. This type of ooze is limited to depths above the Carbonate Compensation Depth at time of burial. It accumulates more rapidly than any other pelagic sediment type, with a rate that varies from 0.3 - 5 cm / 1000 yr.

label: animal feed
definition: Food material which can be used to meet nutritional requirements of animals, particularly livestock such as cattle, goats, sheep, horses, chickens and pigs.

label: contaminated animal feed
definition: Contaminated animal feed is an animal feed that has become contaminated with or come contact with microorganisms or toxic chemicals.

label: coastal water body
definition: Coastal water is a marine water body bordering a coast.

label: obsolete unpasteurized milk product
definition: Raw milk which has not undergone the pasteurization process.

label: umbrella
definition: A canopy designed to protect against precipitation or sunlight.

label: hide
definition: A skin obtained from animals for human use typically from deer or cattle sources used to produce leather, shoes, fashion accessories, musical instruments.

label: bone meal
definition: A mixture of crushed and coarsely ground bones that is used as an organic fertilizer for plants and formerly in animal feed.

label: plant feed
definition: Food material which can be used to meet nutritional requirements of plants.

label: cloth
definition: A textile comprised of a pliable material made usually by weaving, felting, or knitting natural or synthetic fibers and filaments.

label: surface soil
definition: A soil consisting of the upper layer of soil on the surface consisting of loose material capable of supporting life composed of a mixture of mineral and organic matter.

label: letter
definition: A written message from one person to another addressed to a person or organization.

label: coal
definition: A combustible black or brownish-black sedimentary rock usually occurring in rock strata in layers or veins called coal beds or coal seams.

label: ore
definition: a type of rock that contains sufficient minerals with important elements including metals that can be economically extracted from the rock.

label: coal dust
definition: Dust which is derived from coal.

label: mineral dust
definition: Dust which is derived from mineral material.

label: fibrous dust
definition: Dust which is composed of fibrous material.

label: metallic dust
definition: Dust which is composed primarily of some metallic material.

label: clay dust
definition: Dust which is derived from clay material.

label: grain dust
definition: Dust that comes from grain and all the other substances associated with its cultivation & harvesting.

label: open-pit mine
definition: A surface mine that utilizes a technique of extracting rock or minerals from the earth by their removal from an open pit or borrow.

label: fume
definition: A gas, smoke, or vapor that smells strongly or is dangerous to inhale.

label: vanadium fume
definition: Respirable vapor of vanadium.

label: natural wax
definition: A wax that is naturally synthesized by a plant or animal.

label: paraffin wax
definition: A white or colourless soft solid derivable from petroleum, coal or oil shale, that consists of a mixture of hydrocarbon molecules containing between twenty and forty carbon atoms.

label: oil shale
definition: An organic-rich fine-grained sedimentary rock containing kerogen from which liquid hydrocarbons called shale oil can be produced.

label: peat drainage
definition: A hydrological process that results in the drainage of water from peatlands

label: paint
definition: Any liquid, liquefiable, or mastic composition that, after application to a substrate in a thin layer, converts to a solid film. It is most commonly used to protect, color, or provide texture to objects.

label: lead paint
definition: Paint that contains lead.

label: transportation
definition: A planned process that is the movement of people, animals and goods from one location to another.

label: environmental system process
definition: A process in which includes the components of an environmental system as participants.

label: desertification
definition: A type of land degradation in which terrestrial ecosystem becomes increasingly dry, typically losing its bodies of water as well as vegetation and wildlife.

label: flooding
definition: A general and temporary condition of partial or complete inundation of normally dry land areas from the overflow of inland and/or tidal waters, and/or the unusual and rapid accumulation or runoff of surface waters from any source. A great flow along a watercourse or a flow causing inundation of lands not normally covered by water.

label: atmospheric process
definition: A process which occurs within an atmosphere.

label: greenhouse effect
definition: A process by which thermal radiation from a planetary surface is absorbed by atmospheric greenhouse gases, and is re-radiated in all directions. Since part of this re-radiation is back towards the surface and the lower atmosphere, it results in an elevation of the average surface temperature above what it would be in the absence of the gases.

label: land degradation
definition: A process which diminishes the functioning of an ecosystem located on land.

label: ecosystem-wide photosynthesis
definition: A process which consists of all photosynthesis processes instantiated in an ecosystem.

label: ecosystem-wide respiration
definition: A process which consists of all respiration processes instantiated in an ecosystem.

label: biogeochemical cycling
definition: A biogeochemical process during which one or more chemical compounds are sequentially converted into a series of related compounds in a regularly repeating, periodic fashion.

label: carbon cycling
definition: A biogeochemical cycle which has carbon-bearing chemical entities as participants.

label: afforestation
definition: Establishment of a new forest by seeding or planting of nonforested land.

label: deforestation
definition: The removal of forest and undergrowth to, for example, increase the surface of arable land or to use the timber for construction or industrial purposes.

label: reforestation
definition: The planting of trees in areas in where forests have previously been cleared.

label: algal bloom process
definition: A process during which the populations in a community of algae in a marine or freshwater ecosystem undergo rapid growth, resulting in high concentrations of algal cells that occur only periodically and briefly in that ecosystem, relative to their concentrations through the majority of the planetary orbital period.

label: algal bloom collapse
definition: A process during which the rapid growth of algal populations that result in an algal bloom ceases, and cell densities begin to fall due to death, predation, and transport.

label: algal production
definition: A process during which the algal cells constituting an algal bloom produce biomass from abiotic components during photosynthesis.

label: accumulation of toxins from algal bloom process
degradation of toxins from algal bloom process
anthropogenic modulatory intervention process
definition: A process during which humans apply technology to alter the magnitude, duration, rate, or impact of an environmental process.

label: anthropogenic environmental process
definition: An environmental process which is driven by the action of humans.

label: planetary erosion
definition: An action of exogenic processes (such as water flow or wind) which remove environmental material from one part of a planet's crust, transporting it to another location where it is deposited.

label: bedrock dissolution
definition: An erosional process in which bedrock is converted from its solid form into a solute by the action of some solvent.

label: biogeochemical process
definition: A process during which chemicals that are involved in natural ecosystem processes are transported or transformed, and which impact the activity of biological entities

label: hydrological process
definition: An environmental process which has water - in any of its states - as a participant.

label: planned revegetation
definition: A planned process during which human agents establish plant communities in ecosystems which have previously been, partially or wholly, stripped of existing plant communities.

label: evapotranspiration
definition: Evapotranspiration is the sum of evaporation and plant transpiration from the Earth's land and ocean surface to the atmosphere.

label: evaporation
definition: Evaporation is a form of vaporisation which occurs when a portion of the surface layer of a liquid in contact with a gaseous material, which is not saturated with the evaporating substance, vaporises.

label: transpiration
definition: Transpiration is the process of water movement through a plant and its evaporation from aerial parts of that plant, such as from leaves but also from stems and flowers.

label: environmental pollution
definition: An environmental system process that results in the introduction of contaminants into an environment.

label: air pollution
definition: A pollution process during which particulates or other contaminants are released into a portion of air.

label: soil pollution
definition: A pollution process during which contaminants are released into soil.

label: water pollution
definition: A pollution process during which contaminants are released into water.

label: plastic pollution
definition: A pollution process during which plastic contaminants are released into an environmental material.

label: environmental monitoring
definition: An process in which environmental parameters and variables are continually assayed.

label: pollution control
definition: A planned process during which the amount of pollutants released into an environmental system is regulated.

label: pollution monitoring
definition: A monitoring process that assays the level of environmental pollutants to determine the presence of effect of environmental pollution.

label: urban pollution
definition: A pollution process that results in increased levels of pollutants in an urban environment.

label: neve
definition: Partially compacted granular snow, which has undergone several cycles of melting and refreezing while being compacted, usually found on the atmosphere-exposed surface of a glacier.

label: firn
definition: Granular snow which contains a proportion of fused granules formed through melting and re-thawing while being compacted by the weight of overlying material and which contains interconnected gaseous pores.

label: nivation
definition: A material transformation process during which recently precipitated, powdery snow transitions into firn or nv through compaction and/or through cycles of freezing and thawing.

label: glacial ice
definition: Any water ice that is part of a glacier.

label: erosionally enriched glacial ice
definition: Glacial ice which contains material liberated during a glacial erosion process.

label: glacial erosion process
definition: An erosion process during which the movement of a glacier across a terrestrial surface causes the removal of material from that surface.

label: blue ice
definition: Water ice containing little to no air bubbles resulting in a reduction of internal light scattering and, given sufficient volume, a blue appearance.

label: compaction process
definition: A physical process during which atoms, molecules, or other consituents of a material entity are forced closer together.

label: material accumulation process
definition: A process during which the mass of one or more materials, present within a given site, increases.

label: material transport process
definition: A process during which material is displaced from its original location and transported either to a new location or back to the original location.

label: ice gain
definition: A material accumulation process during which the mass of an existing ice mass increases.

label: glacial transport process
definition: A material transport process during which the snow and ice constituting a glacier, and anything contained within it, is transported down a slope by gravitation.

label: cirque glacier
definition: A small glacier contained within a cirque basin.

label: geographic basin
definition: A depression which is part of a planetary crust, is of geographic scale, and is partially or completely enclosed.

label: material decumulation process
definition: A process during which a mass composed of one or more environmental materials, present within a given site, decreases.

label: glacial ice loss
definition: A process during which the mass of ice constituting a glacier decreases.

label: englacial stream
definition: A stream which is primarily composed of meltwater and which flows within a glacier or ice sheet.

label: aeolian transport process
definition: A material transport process during which one or more environmental materials are transported by the action of wind.

label: soot
definition: Particulate matter primarily composed of carbon particles formed through the incomplete combustion of hydrocarbons.

label: erosionally enriched ice
definition: Water ice which contains material liberated during an erosion process.

label: powdery snow
definition: Uncompacted snow containing trapped atmospheric gases.

label: glacial ice gain
definition: A process during which the mass of ice constituting a glacier increases.

label: glacial ice calving process
definition: A process during which a part of a glacier breaks away from the main mass.

label: iceberg calving process
definition: A process during which a part of a glacier breaks away from the main mass as an iceberg.

label: calving of ice from an iceberg
definition: A process during which a part of an iceberg breaks away from the main mass.

label: marine sediment
definition: Sediment which has been transported through the marine water column, settling on the seafloor.

label: shallow marine sediment
definition: Marine sediment soured from either terrestrial systems, marine organisms, seawater and or cosmogeneous sources, which is transported through the marine water column, and accumulates within shallow regions of the oceanic basin close to continents, such as the continental shelf, or continental slope.

label: supraglacial lake
definition: A water body which is located in a depression within the surface of a glacier.

label: sedimentation in a water body
definition: A material accumulation process during which solid particles are pulled through a water body by gravitation or centrifugal force and which ends when they settle on a solid surface.

label: glacial ice ablation zone
definition: An ablation zone which is part of a glacier.

label: cryoconite deposit
definition: Particulate matter which is composed primarily of dust, rock, and soot, as well as the microbial communities associated with these materials, deposited on an ice mass by an aeolian process.

label: cryoconite hole
definition: A vertical thaw hole within an ice mass, formed as a result of ice melt associated with local temperature increases, due to increased absorption of solar radiation by cryoconite deposits.

label: melt pond
definition: A water body which forms as a result of localised melting taking place on the surface of a glacier or a mass of sea ice and which is contained in the cavity formed by such melting.

label: brine channel
definition: A channel through which brine flows.

label: brine channel formation process
definition: A material accumulation process during which brine droplets, trapped between ice crystals formed during seawater freezing, form brine channels.

label: material transformation process
definition: A process during which a portion of some environmental material is converted into a different material or a collection of materials.

label: sea ice formation process
definition: A material transformation process during which seawater freezes into sea ice.

label: brine rejection from seawater
definition: A material transformation process during which brine is formed due to the expulsion of salt during frazil formation or a seawater freezing process.

label: frazil ice
definition: New ice which is composed frazil which has congealed into a thin sheet.

label: frazil ice formation
definition: A new ice formation process during which small, needle-like crystals consisting of nearly pure fresh water, form due to the freezing of open, turbulent, supercooled water.

label: thaw hole
definition: A channel which traverses an ice mass floating on a water body and bridges the atmosphere to the underlying water through its internal cavity.

label: atmosphere-exposed melt pond
definition: A melt pond which has a surface exposed to the atmosphere.

label: ice-encased melt pond
definition: A melt pond which is completely encased in ice and thus not directly exposed to the atmosphere or underlying water.

label: intraglacial lake
