definition: A lake which is comprised of meltwater located underneath or within a glacier.

label: depositional process
definition: A process during which material entities are added to a landform or to a feature upon the landform.

label: desublimation of water vapour into ice
definition: A desublimation process during which water vapour is frozen into water ice.

label: new ice formation process
definition: An ice formation process during which water is frozen into a form of new ice such as frazil, grease ice, slush, or shuga.

label: obsolete sea ice formation process
definition: An ice formation process during which seawater is frozen into a sea ice.

label: nilas formation process
definition: A sea ice formation process during which new ice crystals freeze together, forming nilas, a thin, elastic, continuous, ice sheet of a transparent gray color.

label: young ice formation process
definition: A sea ice formation process during which water freezes to the bottom of an existing nilas ice floe creating a thicker ice floe known as young ice.

label: first year ice formation process
definition: A sea ice formation process during which seawater freezes onto young ice during the cold season, forming first year ice.

label: second year ice formation
definition: A sea ice formation process during which seawater freezes onto first year ice during the cold season, forming second year sea ice.

label: multiyear ice formation process
definition: A sea ice formation process during which seawater freezes into second year ice during the cold season, forming multiyear ice.

label: new ice
definition: Water ice which is formed from freezing water and is suspended in a water body.

label: ice floe
definition: A cohesive and contiguous sheet of water ice which floats upon the surface of a water body.

label: sea ice floe
definition: An ice floe which is formed from frozen sea water, and floats upon the surface of a marine water body.

label: pancake ice
definition: A sea ice floe which has a rounded or circular shape and raised rims.

label: nilas
definition: A sea ice floe which is thin, elastic, continuous, and of a transparent gray color, which results from the freezing of new ice.

label: young ice
definition: A sea ice floe which is inflexible and thicker than nilas.

label: first year ice
definition: Sea ice which has formed over a single freezing season.

label: second year ice
definition: Sea ice which is thicker than first year ice, and has survived a seasonal melting process.

label: multiyear ice
definition: Sea ice which is thicker than second year ice, and has survived more than two seasonal melting process.

label: grease ice layer
definition: A layer which consists of a thin aggregate of frazil ice crystals, which float upon the surface of a water body.

label: shuga
definition: New ice, which is spongy, lumpy and opaque, and forms from water which freezes in an agitated water body.

label: slush ice
definition: A slurry of frazil, snow, and liquid water.

label: slush ice layer
definition: A layer which consists of slush ice.

label: slush formation process
definition: A new ice formation process in which slush ice is formed.

label: shuga formation process
definition: A new ice formation process in which shuga is formed.

label: thermokarst lake
definition: A freshwater lake which fills a depression formed by the erosion of thermokarst caused by permafrost thaw.

label: methane-releasing thermokarst lake
definition: A thermokarst lake through which methane gas released from thawing permafrost, or other methane stores, rises and escapes to the atmosphere.

label: thermokarst depression
definition: A geographic basin which is formed due to the erosion of thermokarst by meltwater released from thawing permafrost.

label: thermokarst
definition: An irregular land surface which consists of marshy hollows, hummocks, thermokarst depressions and thermokarst lakes formed from the erosion of ice-rich thawing permafrost areas.

label: ice-bearing permafrost thawing process
definition: A permafrost thawing process during which water-based ice or snow present in permafrost is converted into meltwater.

label: methane-laden permafrost
definition: Permafrost which contains pockets of trapped methane gas.

label: permafrost crater derived from a methane explosion
definition: A crater which is found in permafrost and formed as a result of an explosion fuelled by methane formerly contained in that permafrost.

label: explosion process
definition: A process during which a material entity undergoes a rapid increase in volume, releasing gasses and various forms of energy, often including thermal, light and sound energy.

label: permafrost methane explosion
definition: An explosion during which methane-rich gas trapped in permafrost combusts.

label: gas emission process
definition: A material transport process during which a portion of gaseous environmental material is transported into the atmosphere.

label: hydrocarbon gas emission process
definition: A gas emission process during which a portion of hydrocarbon gas is transported into the atmosphere.

label: methane gas emission process
definition: A hydrocarbon gas emission process during which a portion of methane gas is transported into the atmosphere.

label: season generating process
definition: A process during which the intesity of stellar radiation received by a planet's surface varies in a cyclical regime due to the planet's orbital motion around the barycentre of a planetary system and/or the tilt of its rotational axis relative to its orbital plane.

label: season
definition: A one-dimensional temporal region which is delimited by the occurrence of processes which serve as its delimiters.

label: warm season
definition: A season during which the average temperature of a planetary part exceeds that of all other seasons it endures during a season generating process.

label: cold season
definition: A season during which the average temperature of a planetary part is below that of all other seasons it endures during a season generating process.

label: seasonal melting process
definition: A material transformation process during which a material entity melts during a warm season.

label: solid-phase sintering
definition: A compaction process during which a material entity subjected to heat and/or pressure is compacted into a solid mass without undergoing melting.

label: glacial sintering
definition: A sintering process during which snow is compacted into glacial ice.

label: aeolian transport of snow
definition: An aeolian transport process during which powdery snow is displaced and moved.

label: snow drift formation
definition: An accumulation process during which a powdery snow carried on the wind settles on a solid surface, forming a mound.

label: slab avalanche
definition: A mass wasting process during which slab snow rapidly moves down a sloping surface.

label: powdery snow avalanche
definition: An avalanche during which powdery snow rapidly flows down a sloping surface.

label: wet snow avalanche
definition: An avalanche during which a suspension of water and snow flows down a sloping surface.

label: slab snow
definition: Snow which is cohesive, hard and overlies weaker snow.

label: cryoform
definition: A geographic feature which is primarily composed of a continuous mass of snow and/or ice.

label: snow mass
definition: A mass of snow.

label: snow drift
definition: An accumulation of powdery snow which was transported and deposited via a snow drifting process.

label: snow patch
definition: An accumulation of snow and firn which rests upon land.

label: seasonal snow patch
definition: A snow patch which forms during a cold season and melts away during the succeeding warm season.

label: perennial snow patch
definition: A snow patch which persists through at least one seasonal cycle.

label: snowpack
definition: A layer which consists of an accumulation of snow.

label: channel
definition: A structure which traverses a mass of one or more environmental materials, and encloses a roughly tubular site.

label: atmosphere and water column exposed melt pond
definition: A melt pond which and is exposed to the atmosphere and to a lesser degree water underlying the ice mass which contains it.

label: water column exposed melt pond
definition: A melt pond which is formed close to that part of an ice mass which is in contact with some underlying water body, and which has channels connecting it to that water body.

label: subglacial lake
definition: A lake which is situated beneath a glacier.

label: erosion through nivation
definition: An erosion process during which rock or soil is removed or degraded due to alternative thawing and freezing of meltwater beneath and at the margins of snowbanks.

label: planned burn
definition: A fire which is planned and executed deliberately under human supervision.

label: concentration of nitrate and nitrite in liquid water
definition: The concentration of nitrate and nitrite when measured in liquid water.

label: acid rainfall
definition: A water-based rainfall process during which water droplets with increased acidity fall towards a planetary surface.

label: acidic water-based rain
definition: Water-based rain which has increased acidity.

label: monsoon season
definition: A season during which changes in atmospheric circulation associated with the asymmetric heating of land and sea cause moisture to be brought inland by monsoon winds, leading to increased rainfall as moisture-laden air rises  and cools over land.

label: monsoon wind
definition: An atmospheric wind during which air masses over an ocean flow towards a land mass, driven by disequilibria between land and ocean surface temperatures.

label: grass fire
definition: A fire which occurs in a grassland, combusting biomass stored in grasses as its primary fuel.

label: firebreak
definition: A woodland clearing which is large enough to starve land fires of fuel, impeding their progress through wooded areas.

label: playground
definition: A park which has been designed for the recreation of children.

label: public park
definition: A park which is owned by a governmental or state entity and which is accessible by its citizenry (i.e. the public).

label: public sports field
definition: A sports facility which has been constructed for sports that require large outdoor spaces and is owned by a governmental or state entity and which is accessible by its citizenry (i.e. the public).

label: bike path
definition: A constructed pavement which is intended for bicycle traffic

label: anthropogenic litter
definition: An anthropogenic environmental material consisting of any object no longer wanted and discarded outside of approved trash receptacles.

label: food desert
definition: An anthropogenic environment in which populations of humans have limited acess to affordable and nutritious food.

label: noisy environment
definition: An environment in which entities are exposed to either excessive or constant sound.

label: safe environment for human presence
definition: An environment in which humans have a low likelihood of being harmed or killed.

label: attractive environment
definition: An environment which includes components which are deemed to be aesthetically pleasing by a population of humans.

label: shady environment
definition: An environmental system which is shielded from direct stellar irradiation by material entities.

label: violent environment
definition: An environment in which humans are exposed to regularly occurring physical or emotional violence.

label: adfreezing
definition: Adfreezing is a freezing process during which two objects adhere to each other via ice.

label: frost heaving process
definition: Frost heaving is a process during which an upwards swelling of soil occurs due to freezing conditions caused by an increasing presence of ice as it grows towards the surface.

label: temperature of sea surface
definition: A water temperature which inheres in water close to the surface of an ocean or sea.

label: concentration of carbon dioxide in soil
definition: The concentration of carbon dioxide when measured in soil.

label: concentration of carbon dioxide in air
definition: The concentration of carbon dioxide when measured in air.

label: concentration of carbon dioxide in freshwater
definition: The concentration of carbon dioxide when measured in freshwater.

label: concentration of carbon dioxide in seawater
definition: The concentration of carbon dioxide when measured in seawater.

label: lake water
definition: Water which is part of a lake.

label: soil organic matter
definition: Organic material in soil, which consists of plant and animal residues at various stages of decomposition, cells and tissues of soil organisms, and substances synthesized by soil organisms.

label: active permafrost layer
definition: A layer which is composed of ground that is 1) subject to annual thawing and freezing and 2) present in areas underlain by permafrost.

label: soil surface layer
definition: A surface layer which is composed primarily of soil.

label: bare soil surface layer
definition: A soil surface which is exposed to the troposphere, with no appreciable cover from vegetation or other material.

label: particulate organic matter
definition: Particulate matter which is composed primarily of organic material.

label: particulate organic carbon
definition: Particulate organic matter which is composed primarily of carbon.

label: particulate organic nitrogen
definition: Particulate organic matter which is composed primarily of nitrogen.

label: carbon sequestration process
definition: A material accumulation process during which atmospheric carbon dioxide is captured and stored.

label: biotic carbon sequestration
definition: A carbon sequestration process during which atmospheric carbon dioxide is captured and stored by biological processes.

label: geological carbon sequestration
definition: A carbon sequestration process during which carbon dioxide is stored in underground geological formations.

label: carbon sequestration by the ocean carbonate system
definition: A carbon sequestration process during which carbon dioxide is stored in the carbonate system of an ocean.

label: axilla skin environment
definition: An environment that is determined by an axilla skin.

label: mouth environment
definition: An environment that is determined by a mouth.

label: solubility of carbon atom in environmental material
definition: The solubility of a carbon atom when measured in environmental material.

label: solubility of carbon atom in soil
definition: The solubility of a carbon atom when measured in soil.

label: solubility of carbon atom in water
definition: The solubility of a carbon atom when measured in water.

definition: The amount of a carbon atom when measured in environmental material.

label: amount of carbon atom in soil
definition: The amount of a carbon atom when measured in soil.

label: solubility of nitrogen atom in environmental material
definition: The solubility of a nitrogen atom when measured in environmental material.

definition: The solubility of a nitrogen atom when measured in soil.

label: solubility of nitrogen atom in water
definition: The solubility of a nitrogen atom when measured in water.

definition: The amount of a nitrogen atom when measured in environmental material.

definition: The amount of a nitrogen atom when measured in soil.

definition: The concentration of a nitrogen atom when measured in environmental material.

label: concentration of nitrogen atom in soil
definition: The concentration of a nitrogen atom when measured in soil.

label: concentration of nitrogen atom in water
definition: The concentration of a nitrogen atom when measured in water.

label: concentration of chloride in water
definition: The concentration of a chloride when measured in water.

label: dissolved carbon atom in environmental material
definition: The carbon atom in a dissolved state when measured in environmental material.

label: dissolved carbon atom in soil
definition: The carbon atom in a dissolved state when measured in soil.

label: dissolved carbon atom in water
definition: The carbon atom in a dissolved state when measured in water.

label: dissolved nitrogen atom in environmental material
definition: The nitrogen atom in a dissolved state when measured in environmental material.

label: dissolved nitrogen atom in soil
definition: The nitrogen atom in a dissolved state when measured in soil.

label: dissolved nitrogen atom in water
definition: The nitrogen atom in a dissolved state when measured in water.

label: temperature of environmental material
definition: The temperature of some environmental material.

label: temperature of air
definition: The temperature of some air.

label: environmental system process quality
definition: The quality of a environmental system process.

label: atmospheric wind intensity
definition: The intensity of a atmospheric wind.

label: porosity of soil
definition: The porosity of some soil.

label: mass density of soil
definition: The mass density of some soil.

label: concentration of ammonium in soil
definition: The concentration of a ammonium when measured in soil.

label: concentration of nitrate in soil
definition: The concentration of a nitrate when measured in soil.

label: composition of soil
definition: The composition of some soil.

label: structure of soil
definition: The structure of some soil.

label: acidity of soil
definition: The acidity of some soil.

label: pressure of air
definition: The pressure of some air.

label: temperature of soil
definition: The temperature of some soil.

label: wetness of soil
definition: The wetness of some soil.

label: temperature of water
definition: The temperature of some water.

label: humidity of soil
definition: The humidity of some soil.

label: conductivity of soil
definition: The conductivity of some soil.

label: composition of water
definition: The composition of some water.

label: conductivity of water
definition: The conductivity of some water.

label: concentration of nitrate in groundwater
definition: The concentration of a nitrate when measured in groundwater.

label: obsolete concentration of oxygen in water
definition: OBSOLETE The concentration of a oxygen when measured in water.

label: drought
definition: A hydrological precipitation process with a reduced rate relative to some historical average, typically resulting in ecosystemic perturbations.

label: marine mucilage
definition: A gelatinous material primarily composed of exopolymeric compounds with colloidal properties, formed through the aggregation of marine snow particles, often found in large sheets,  flocs, and clouds.

label: exudation of carbohydrates
definition: A process in which carbohydrates are transported from the interior of an organism to its surroundings.

label: island formation process
definition: A process which results in the formation of an island.

label: microcontinental island
definition: An island created when a continent is rifted.

label: depositional island
definition: An island formed by deposition of solid material such as sand or small rocks where a water current loses some of its carrying capacity.

label: barrier island
definition: An island formed by the accumulation of sand deposited by sea currents on a continental shelves

label: chemical product
definition: A manufactured product that is some mixture of chemicals created through some chemical engineering process

label: creosote
definition: The portion of chemical products obtained by the distillation of a tar that remains heavier than water, notably useful for its anti-septic and preservative properties

label: industrial wastewate treatment plant
definition: A wastewater treatment plant that treates industrial wastewater. Industrial wastewater treatment covers the mechanisms and processes used to treat waters that have been contaminated in some way by anthropogenic industrial or commercial activities prior to its release into the environment or its re-use.

label: agricultural wastewater treatment plant
definition: A wastewater treatment plant that treats agriculatural wastewater. Agricultural wastewater treatment relates to the treatment of wastewaters produced in the course of agricultural activities. Agriculture is a highly intensified industry in many parts of the world, producing a range of wastewaters requiring a variety of treatment technologies and management practices.

label: algal bloom
definition: A feature that arises from a rapid increase or accumulation in the population of algae (typically microscopic) in an aquatic system.

label: freshwater algal bloom
definition: An algal bloom that is located in freshwater. Freshwater algal blooms are the result of an excess of nutrients, particularly some phosphates.

label: nest of termite
definition: An animal habitation constructed by termites. Termite workers build and maintain nests which house the colony. These are elaborate structures made using a combination of soil, mud, chewed wood/cellulose, saliva, and faeces. A nest has many functions such as providing a protected living space and water conservation (through controlled condensation).

label: biochar
definition: charcoal that is used as a soil amendment.

label: lignite
definition: A soft, brown, combustible, sedimentary rock formed from naturally compressed peat.

label: bitumous coal
definition: a relatively soft coal containing a tarlike substance called bitumen or asphalt. It is of higher quality than lignite coal but of poorer quality than anthracite. It is an organic sedimentary rock formed by diagenetic and sub metamorphic compression of peat bog material.

label: anthracite
definition: A hard, compact variety of coal that has a submetallic luster. It has the highest carbon content, the fewest impurities, and the highest energy density of all types of coal and is the highest ranking of coal.

label: anthropogenic generation of energy
definition: The generation of energy for use by humans

label: energy
definition: A disposition which is realized during the execution of work, the emission of heat, or the possession of mass.

label: potential energy
definition: Energy possessed by an object because of its position relative to other objects, stresses within itself, its electric charge, or other factors.

label: kinetic energy
definition: Energy that it realized through motion.

label: electric energy
definition: potential energy due to or stored in electric fields.

label: magnetic energy
definition: potential energy due to or stored in magnetic fields.

label: gravitational energy
definition: potential energy due to or stored in gravitational fields.

label: chemical energy
definition: potential energy due to chemical bonds.

label: ionization energy
definition: potential energy that binds an electron to its atom or molecule.

label: nuclear energy
definition: potential energy that binds nucleons to form the atomic nucleus (and nuclear reactions).

label: chromodynamic energy
definition: Potential energy due to the energy of the gluon-mediated field of the strong force, binding quarks together into hadrons.

label: elastic energy
definition: potential energy due to the deformation of a material (or its container) exhibiting a restorative force.

label: mechanical wave energy
definition: kinetic and potential energy in an elastic material due to a propagated deformational wave.

label: sound wave energy
definition: kinetic and potential energy in a fluid due to a sound propagated wave.

label: radiant energy
definition: potential energy stored in the fields of propagated by electromagnetic radiation, including light.

label: rest energy
definition: potential energy due to an object's rest mass.

label: thermal energy
definition: Kinetic energy which is realized through the microscopic motion of particles, a form of disordered mechanical energy.

label: geothermal energy
definition: Thermal energy which propagates through a solid (typically rocky) astronomical body.

label: fossil fuel power plant
definition: A power station which burns a fossil fuel such as coal, natural gas, or petroleum to produce electricity.

label: coke
definition: Coal heated in the absence of air.

label: oxygen cycling
definition: A biogeochemical cycle which has oxygen as participant.

label: anatomical entity environment
definition: An environment which is determined by an anatomical entity.

label: intestine environment
definition: An environmental system determined by an intestine.

label: skin environment
definition: An environment determined by an area or zone of skin tissue.

label: microwave radiation
definition: A radiation process during which electromagnetic waves or their quanta are emitted at wavelengths and frequencies which travel exclusively in a line-of-sight fashion and which may produce molecular rotation and torsion on contact with matter.

label: radio wave radiation
definition: A radiation process during which electromagnetic waves or their quanta are emitted at wavelengths ranging from millimetre to kilometer scales.

label: infrared radiation
definition: A radiation process during which electromagnetic waves or their quanta are emitted when molecules change their rotational-vibrational movements, usually at wavelengths between 760 nm and 1 mm.

label: visible spectrum radiation
definition: A radiation process during which electromagnetic waves or their quanta are emitted at wavelengths between 380 nm and 760 nm.

label: ultraviolet radiation
definition: A radiation process during which electromagnetic waves or their quanta are emitted at wavelengths between 10 nm and 400 nm.

label: X-ray radiation
definition: A radiation process during which penetrating electromagnetic radiation is emitted by high-energy electrons as they fall into a lower state of energy.

label: gamma-ray radiation
definition: A radiation process during which penetrating electromagnetic radiation is emitted from the radioactive decay (gamma decay) of atomic nuclei.

label: ionizing radiation
definition: A radiation process during which electromagnetic waves or their quanta are emitted with sufficient energy to disrupt molecular bonds or alter the electron number of atoms.

label: Suni
definition: "Suni, or Jalca, is one of the eight Natural Regions of Peru. It is located in the Andes at an altitude between 3,500 and 4,000 metres above sea level. Suni has a dry and cold weather and there are many glacial valleys. The flora includes gramineous plants and shrubs such as the taya-taya (Caesalpinia spinosa), the quishuar (Buddleja coriacea), and the cantuta (Cantua buxifolia) which was considered sacred by the Incas. Even though it is hard for plants to grow because of the weather, people are able to cultivate such crops as quinoa, qaiwa, broad beans and ulluku (Ullucus tuberosus). The main fauna is the guinea pig and, among numerous other highland birds, the Chiguanco thrush."

label: World Ocean
definition: Earth's interconnected water system
